loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, age 31, is requesting a loan amount PHP 7,000 to stock up her variety store. It will go to purchase soft drinks, breads, canned goods and milk.  She lacks the capital needed for this investment, and she doesn't want to stop this business because this the only source of income she has. 

Eunice wants to provide the best for her two children who are in her care. With the loan, she hopes her business will have more sales and will generate more income so that she will be able to provide for her children’s education and to have an improved lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, breads, canned goods and milk

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is married with 4 children. He is 38 years old and lives in Sinusa, Ozamis City, Philippines.

Elias makes and sells a variety of food snacks such as ice drops, ice candy and etc for his living. He has been doing this for 5 years and every month he earn PHP 5,000 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make ice drops for sale.

In 2011, Elias joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Elias hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make ice drops for sale

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 32 years old and lives in Manila, the Philippines. She is married to Enrique, a vendor, and the mother of two children. She earns a living by operating a variety store where she sells convenience items such as groceries, toiletries and beverages to people who live in her neighborhood. She buys her supplies wholesale and sells retail. She also sell cooked foods as a way to earn additional income. Her store is next to her house. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to sell. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Geraldine faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gena

texts.en: Gena is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and the mother of three children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by running a food/retail shop (or sari-sari) store where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers. Gena joined HSPFI last year and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of shampoo, cereals and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is married and the mother of one child. She is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines, where she runs a service-based business providing transportation services to people who live in her community. She's been doing this for the last five years and earns about PHP 4,000 a month. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to repair the vehicle she uses in her business. Last year, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living conditions. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's life.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle she uses to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El socio en esta oportunidad tambien se sigue cuidando respecto a su salud.El socio solicita el credito para su salud para comprar medicamentos y tambien para comprar un artefacto un televisor para su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
On this occasion, the borrower is also continuing to look after himself with respect to his health. He is applying for a loan for health reasons, in order to buy medicines, and also to buy a television for his home.

The borrower is happy about receiving the loan, and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: To buy medicines for health reasons and also a television for his home.

loans.name: Lupicinia

texts.en: Lupicinia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and three children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by raising and selling pigs. She is requesting a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy feed for her animals. She joined HSPFI earlier this year in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a pig-raising business.

loans.name: Juliana Antonia

texts.es:
Doña Juliana Antonia se gana la vida como una pequeña comerciante donde su negocio consiste en la venta de comida y refrescos el cual lo tiene ubicado en su vivienda donde ofrece variedad de comida rápida todos los días de la semana, en este negocio tiene varios años de trabajar desde que dejó de laborar como conserje en un centro de estudio de la localidad y el que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.
Es una señora luchadora que ha criado a sus hijos sola, con su propio esfuerzo los ha sacado adelante los que hoy son personas independientes y de bien.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio con el fin de comprar azúcar, arroz, frutas y golosinas para elaborar variedad de comida y refrescos para atraer a los clientes y satisfacer la demanda de los mismos.
Confía en Dios que ceprodel le apoye con su solicitud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Juliana Antonio earns a living as a small businesswoman.  She has a business of selling food and soft drinks, and the business is located in her home.  She offers a variety of fast food every day of the week.  Ever since she left her job several years ago as custodian for a local study center, she has been working in this business.  The business allows her to bring home the daily bread.

She is a tenacious lady who has raised her children by herself.  Through her own efforts she has gotten them ahead, and they are now independent and upright people.

She currently needs a loan to invest in her business by purchasing sugar, rice, fruit, and candy.  She will buy these items in order to make a variety of food and drinks to attract customers and to meet their demand.

She trusts in God that Ceprodel will grant her request in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, fruit, and candy.

loans.name: Elvia Maribel

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de peluches,ella vende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de peluches.La socia solicita el credito para comprar peluches al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is still selling stuffed toys. She sells from 9:00am to 8:00pm. By means of this business she wants to succeed in life. Her dream is to expand her stuffed toy business. The borrower is applying for the loan in order to buy stuffed toys at wholesale.

The borrower is happy about receiving the loan, and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy stuffed toys at wholesale.

loans.name: Marietha

texts.en:
This is Marietha, 32, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rodante, her business partner, and is a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marietha operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marietha hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa is 45 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 14, 17 and 21 years old. She is involved in fishing. Maria Luisa's husband is a fisherman and is the one who operates their fishing boat. Maria Luisa sells his catch at their town's market. In the afternoon, Maria Luisa sells banana cue to her neighborhood. 

Maria Luisa is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets, lead weights and floaters. She hopes to have a better income that would help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, lead weights and floaters.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Lydia has a shop that sells school uniforms, gowns for graduation, and curtains. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to buy cloth for making curtains, uniforms and in different designs.

Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth, sewing machine and curtains.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is married with three children. Everlyne is 32 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Everlyne sells food for snacks to earn a living and had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her snack vending business.

Everlyne has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Everlyne hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 48 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

Rosario works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Rosario has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Rosario hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a seaweed farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 36 years old and married with three children, ages 6, 9 and 10 years old. Rosalina's husband works as a fisherman.

Rosalina has been growing seaweed for ten years. She earns about 2,700 PHP per month doing this farming. She also helps sell her husband's catch of fresh fish at the market. She plans to use her loan to purchase fishing nets and seaweed seedlings. Rosalina hopes to earn better income to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité es un grupo muy activo, que se encuentra en el ciclo numero 8 , tienen ahorros y caja chica que les facilitan el retiro del próximo crédito . 
La Sra. Rosa es una integrante del grupo, y siempre supo salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y de hielos, y nos cuenta que a través de su esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido ir creciendo y de esa forma llegar a donde está. La Sra. Rosa quiere  que su negocio siga creciendo siempre con el correr de los años y es por esto que siempre se esfuerza. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de locotes, tomates, cebollas, pepinos, y demás verduras con las cuales podrá seguir trabajando y de esa forma ofrecer una buena variedad a sus clientes
texts.en:
This is a very active group who are currently in their eighth loan cycle. They have savings and cash to ease the paying back of their next loan.

Sra. Rosa is a member of the group. She has always managed to get ahead in life.  She sells vegetables and ice. Rosa explains that it is through effort and sacrifice that she has been able to grow her business and arrive at where she is now. She wants her business to continue thriving over the coming years so she always makes an effort. 

Rosa is seeking a loan to buy green peppers, tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, and other vegetables so her business will do well and she has a variety of produce to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy green peppers, tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, and other vegetables

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
El comité actualmente se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa, y su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa. 
La Sra. Fulvia es integrante del comité, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada con el Sr Edgar quien es carpintero juntos tienen 3 hijos. La Sra Fulvia se dedica a la venta de Comestibles  en su casa. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que sus comidas son muy aceptadas por los vecinos. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, panificados, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir preparando los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
This group is currently in the first loan cycle of the program. Their goal is to be able to continue working so they can reach the highest level of the program. 

43-year old Sra. Fulvia is a member of the group. She is married to Sr. Edgar, a carpenter, and they have three children. She sells cooked food from her home. She has very good customers and the food she sells is welcomed by her neighbours. 

Fulvia is seeking a loan to buy meat, baked goods, seasonings and other ingredients so she can continue preparing food to sell.

loans.use: to buy meat, baked goods, seasonings and other ingredients

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
This is Juliet, 37, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ronnie, a seaman, and is a mother to her two children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Juliet operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Juliet hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 61-year-old married woman with two adult children. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in Bien Unido, Bohol. Sabina sells items like snacks, canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce and rice. She is able to help provide for her family's daily needs with her income.

Sabina is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell, such as rice, canned goods and gasoline. Sabina is planning to start another business to help augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as rice, canned goods and gasoline.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has no children. 

Annalyn has a shop that sells different kinds of animal feed like Purina, pigrolac uni feeds, and animal medicines and vitamins for deworming. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy additional inventory of animal feed and rice to sell.

Annalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Annalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal medicine, vitamins, rice and feed.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with two children. Josephine is 36 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Josephine has a beauty salon. She has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns approximately 14,900 PHP. She has requested a loan to purchase equipment for her beauty salon. Josephine has been a member of PMPC for three years.

In the future, Josephine hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Daniela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Daniela es una joven de 22 años de edad, originaria de Estelí, casada, madre de un hijo el cual esta a su cargo, realizo estudios de estilista, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de zapatos usados. Inicio su actividad con dinero que le presto su mama a la edad de 20 años, anteriormente tenia un salón de belleza pero lo quito por el embarazo ya que no le daba tiempo para cuidar su salud, en su actual negocio cuenta  con el apoyo de su esposo, ella espera seguir comercializando su producto en la misma zona ya que queda enfrente de una fabrica donde vende rápido sus zapatos. 
Realiza el préstamo para la compra de zapatos como manera de invertir en su negocio ya que  podrá vender más productos que le generara mayores ingresos, sus planes futuros es abrir el negocio de salón de belleza para buscar otras manera de salir adelante con su familia, como metas próxima desea ampliar el negocio de venta de zapato, poner un negocio en otro lugar y poner su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Daniela is a young woman of 22. She is from Estelí, married, and the mother of a son who is in her care. She studied to be a hair stylist. Now a merchant by trade, she sells used shoes.

She started this business with money that her mother lent her when she was 20. She previously had a beauty salon, but closed it because of the pregnancy, as it didn't allow her time to look after her health. In her current business she has her husband's support. She hopes to continue selling her product in the same area, as it is located opposite a factory, so she sells her shoes quickly. 

She is taking out the loan to buy shoes as a way of investing in her business, as this will enable her sell more products, which will generate greater income for her. Her future plan is to open the beauty salon business in order to seek other ways for her and her family to succeed in life. Her near-term goals are to expand the shoe business, to set up a business in another location, and to set up her beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Roxie

texts.en: Entrepreneurship was always in the back of her mind, but dealing with the economy and businesses put on hold, Roxie, single mother of two, was encouraged to begin her own business. In August, Roxie began her franchise with RRS Holding Group and opened her New Orleans home-based business,"Candy Bouquet", which provides customers with custom-designed bouquets of candy. Since then, Roxie enrolled in college to learn better ways to market her product. Roxie still works part-time in a retail store and hopes to leave as her business develops. She chose the bouquet business because it is economical to begin and easy to get positive results, she says. At the moment, she employees one assistant but plans to hire three to five more employees in the near future. Prior to requesting an ACCION Texas Inc. loan, Roxie visited her local bank but was denied funding. She later found out about ACCION through a socio-economic development program. Roxie used the loan money for training classes, travel expenses and to purchase the candy bouquet starter kit. “The difference is these candies are made … out of Arkansas,” Roxie says. “And the chocolate is extra whipped. As far as baskets, they are custom-made and the stems are made by hand. It’s not like a wooden stick into Styrofoam,” she adds. Through the loan, Roxie plans to advertise on the Candy Bouquet website, at www.candybouquet.com. Without the assistance of ACCION, Roxie says, “I probably wouldn’t be able to purchase the franchise.”

loans.use: to pay for inventory, training and travel expenses.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Unidas”  están  en el Primer ciclo, con 17  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy activas  y responsables, ellas se esfuerzan al máximo para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo. 
Lurdes es miembro de este grupo y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de leche. Empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día, ya que debe tener la leche para la hora del desayuno. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo poder ayudar a su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas (United Women) group is in their first loan cycle. There are seventeen women in the group and they are well known in the neighbourhood for being very active and responsible. They work as hard as they can to help their families.

Lurdes is a member of the group. She sells milk products. She starts work very early in the morning as she must have the milk available for breakfast. She is a hardworking person and is very keen to get ahead and help her family.

Lurdes is seeking a loan to buy milk so she has sufficient stock to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Unidas” y está integrado por 20 mujeres de Ciudad del Este, quienes decidieron unirse al programa de la fundación paraguaya para que de esa forma puedan ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto. 
La presidenta del grupo es la Sra. Porfiria, ella se dedica a la confección de ropas y con ello ayuda a su familia a generar ingresos y elevar su calidad de vida. Comenta que siempre está con mucho trabajo y pedidos de sus clientes por lo que le va muy bien. 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas botones y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) comunal bank is comprised of 20 women from the Ciudad del Este.  They decided to join the Fundación Paraguaya program in order to be able to help their families by working together.

Porfiria is the president of the group.  She makes clothes.  With this business she helps her family generate income and improve their quality of life.  She says that she always has a lot of work and orders from her customers.  Therefore, it is going very well for her.

She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other supplies in order to be able to keep working.  This way she will finish her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora María es  una persona muy responsable  que se  preocupa  por  el  bienestar  de  su  familia,  su mayor  sueño es acondicionar   la casa  que  con  esfuerzo a  adquirido, ya que  es  el  patrimonio de  su  familia,  en este  momento  ella  requiere  impermeabilizar  el techo de  su  vivienda ya que  nos comenta  que  en estas   temporadas  de  lluvia  a  sido  afectada debido a que  el agua  entra a  su  vivienda  y a llegado  a   dañar   sus   muebles, agradece  el apoyo  brindado para la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en:
María is a very responsible person who is concerned about the well-being of her family.  Her biggest dream is to fix up the home which she acquired with effort, as it is her legacy to her children. 

Currently, she needs to weather-proof the roof of her home.  She tells us that these seasons of rain have affected her since the water enters her home and has damaged her furniture.  She is grateful for the support offered for the completion of her project.

loans.use: to weather-proof her home.

loans.name: Aimee

texts.en: Aimee is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Aimee has a sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Aimee has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of shampoo, soap, snack foods and beverages

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is 36 years old and a very responsible mother of two school-aged children. She is married to Jose from Sta. Isabel province of Isabela. She is engaged in selling a variety of products to the people of their village. She is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy more products such as spices, snack food and drinks for her store. In the future, she hopes that her business will expand so that she can support her family.

loans.use: to buy products such as spices, snack food and drinks for her business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 37, has one child in school. To provide for her child's needs, Arlene has had a retail business selling various grocery items like snack foods, drinks, shampoo and soap for nine years. She will not get tired of the businesses because it is her source of income that provides for her family needs.
Arlene’s priority is preparing for the education of her child. She wishes to maintain the business and earn higher income as well. Arlene is requesting a loan of P30,000 to buy additional grocery items like spices, powdered juice and canned goods to sell. She hopes to send her child through college with the profit she will earn from the business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items like spices, powdered juice and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en: Esperanza is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Esperanza has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 14,000 to increase her stock. Esperanza has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of powdered soap, canned goods, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en: Analisa, 44, is married with 8 children. She lives in Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Analisa has owned a general store to earn a living for 10 years. Each month, she earns 1200 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10000 to purchase more stock for her general store. Analisa has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Analisa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
This is Loida, 46, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Roberto, a sports coach and a father to her three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Loida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and reselling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Loida dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 48 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has one child.

Celestina has a bakeshop that bakes and sells bread, cookies, and cakes. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase flour and baking ingredients.

Celestina has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business to other places.

loans.use: To purchase additional flour and baking ingredients

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child.

Ramil has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. He has had this business for one year. He requested a loan for 14,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ramil has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods,soft drinks, and snacks.

loans.name: Learnie

texts.en: Learnie is 34 years old and married with four grown children. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for three years. Learnie is asking for a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy feed and additional piglets for her hog raising business in order to earn additional income to support the needs of her family. Learnie hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets for her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, 58, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her two children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Virginia maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products of popular brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Virginia's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 5,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 43,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Virginia hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma.ruby

texts.en:
Ma.Ruby is 40 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines with her three children. 

She buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages through her food/retail shop, or sari-sari store. She has been operating this business for one year. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ma.Ruby has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, snacks and shampoo.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding to earn more profits in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Loreta provides motorcycle services with her husband operating as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

Loreta has been a member of HSPFI since 2008, and she hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: purchase gasoline and maintain her motorcycles

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa is from Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old. Flordelisa is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Flordelisa owns and operates a coconut production business. Flordelisa has been in this business for five years and earns PHP 10,000 a month. In 2007, she joined GDMPC. Flordelisa is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to pay for the labor cost in coconut harvests. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost in coconut harvests.

loans.name: Teresito

texts.en: Teresito is 39 years old and is a married man with 3 children ages 10, 12 and 15. He is a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for 6 years. He earns about 4500 PHP per month from his business. Teresito plans to use his loan to repair his fishing boat. He hopes for his business to grow and for his income to improve so that he can sustain his children's education.

loans.use: to repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.

Mary Jane has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Mary Jane  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman who has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding to hire more employees in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase shop items of wheat flour, maize flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase shop items of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Luminarda

texts.en: Luminarda is a 63 years old widow and mother of three children.  She lives in Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. Luminarda owns and operates a farm, where she plants and harvests rice to sell to earn a living.  She has been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Luminarda joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.

Charita has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Charita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soft drinks, and beverages.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is a 53-year-old married woman with one child. She has been engaged in her hog-raising business for four years. Aside from hog raising, she also manages a farming business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed and an additional piglet to raise to have additional income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and a piglet for her business

loans.name: Wilbeth

texts.en:
As a single mother, Wilbeth needs to double her efforts in selling fruits and vegetables to the people in the village where they live. She has been selling her merchandise for more than four years now. She usually earns about P300 a day. She is 27 years old and has one child. She would like to sell more vegetables so she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy bananas, cabbages, potatoes and string beans to sell. 

Wilbeth would like to make her business more profitable and further expand to save for their expenses.

Wilbeth's main goal is to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cabbages, potatoes and string beans to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase items such as wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her store. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase shop items of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 38-year-old lady and married to Ricky, 42 years old. They are blessed with 5 children. They are: Feni, 18; Fani, 17; Fanti, 11; Simon, 8 and Florentina, 6. All of them are attending school. 

Besides taking responsibility as a mother and housewife, Maria also needs to assist her husband in generating money for her family. Her husband Ricky is working on another island and can return home once every 6 months. In order to fulfill the needs of her family, Maria runs a small business selling kerosene. Three times a week Maria buys kerosene from the distributor and resells it.

Currently Maria is seeking money for her children's educational costs as her profit from selling kerosene is only sufficient to meet daily needs. Her daughter Feni will face a national examination soon and absolutely needs a bigger amount of money. This is the reason why Maria is requesting a loan from TLM of IDR 3,500,000. Maria is planning to improve her business by selling more kerosene from the loan. Maria is hoping that she can improve her family life through the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more kerosene

loans.name: Aproniana

texts.en:
Aproniana is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Aproniana has a pigpen that sells grown and mature pigs. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs, such as Purina feed, Pigrolac and Unifeeds, as well as medicine for deworming the piglets.

Aproniana has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Aproniana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, vitamins and medicines

loans.name: Vien

texts.en: Vien would like to take a further loan to buy more foods to sell from her stall. Vien's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more foods to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Cuneta

texts.en:
Cuneta is married with 2 children. Cuneta is 46 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Sur.

Cuneta has a business selling charcoal retail to earn a living and had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase sacks of charcoal to retail.

Cuneta has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Cuneta hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son would like to take a further loan to buy more food to sell from her stall. 

Son's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a single woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a grocery selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more profits in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga would like to take a further loan to buy better ingredients for making pancakes to sell from her stall. Nga's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy better ingredients for making pancakes.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of stock for her general store.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Suong would like to take out a further loan to buy more food to sell from her stall. Suong's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is 39 years old and is a married woman with a 10-year-old child. She has been involved in fishing for 8 years. Tessie works hard to help provide for her family. She has requested a loan to buy one bundle of fishing nets, lead weights and floaters. Tessie hopes to earn better and be able to renovate their house. She also hopes to acquire more fishing boats in the future.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of fishing nets, lead weights and floaters

loans.name: Elvis Axamir

texts.es: Don Elvis, continua trabajando en su vehiculo propio como taxista, siendo este su principal medio para mantener a su familia. Con creditos anteriores ha podido invertirle a su automovil pues manifiesta que al solventarle las necesidades basicas de su familia, le queda muy poco para invertirle al mismo, motivo por el cual acude a la microfinanciera que ha sido el auxilio economico cuando su medio de trabajo siendo este su taxi lo ha necesitado. Con este quinto ciclo de credito lo invertira en la compra de articulos que ayudaran a que su vehiculo se mantega en buen estado tales como: cuatro llantas y de paso realizarle una alineacion de direccion a su carro; con esta inversion lograra que ahora que se acercan las grandes lluvias en nuestro pais no se quede con su vehiculo por estar en mal estado y que su seguridad sea mas solida, siendo esta despues del bienestar de su familia su prioridad.
texts.en:
Elvis continues working in his own vehicle as a taxi drive.  This is his main means of supporting his family.  With previous loans he has been able to invest in his automobile.  He states that after paying for his family’s basic necessities there is very little left to invest in his business.

That is why he comes to the small business lenders who have given him financial assistance when his means of work, his taxi, has needed it.  This is his fifth loan cycle, and he will use the loan to buy items that will help him keep his vehicle in good shape.  He will buy things like four tires, and he will have wheel alignment done on his car.

With this investment he will, now that the heavy rains in our country are approaching, not be left with his vehicle in a bad state.  He will be safer, and after the well-being of his family, his safety is his priority.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 34, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a taxi driver. Thuy supports her family by running a business selling beauty products. She started this business twelve years ago. 

Thuy is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of beauty products to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of beauty products to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
Ephraim is 53 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamiz City. She is separated with 4 children. 

Ephraim has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Ephraim has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Ephraim hopes to improve her living situation, to be able to support her family, especially in their daily basic needs and for education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

To earn a living, Janeth has a business selling rice and delicious cooked dishes. She earns about PHP 10,000 per month doing this type of work. Janeth has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for cooking viands: fresh vegetables, cooking oil, salt, seasoning, pork, and rice.

Janeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Janeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used in making food: fresh vegetables, cooking oil and salt

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is a 53-year-old married woman with three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Oanh and her husband have run a food stall in front of her house for the past twenty-seven years. They sell sandwichs and bread with pork and sausage. She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing food and good quality foods and ingredients at a wholesale price. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy breads and good quality foods at a wholesale price

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity  but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a beauty salon business; her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more profits in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase hair food oil, perfumes and hair weaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair food oil, perfumes and hair weaves.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is 48 years old and is married. She lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money by working as a bricklayer. 

Thao earns an income to support her family running a business selling leather shoes. She intends to use her loan to buy a great quantity and variety of  shoes to sell.

Thao hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for any future difficulties.

loans.use: To buy a great quantity and variety of  shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cto buy new, assorted clothes for her business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is happy living with her husband and children. She is forty years of age and blessed with four children. Lucila is patiently managing her business, a sari-sari store. She is usually sells biscuits, shampoo and sugar. To gain additional income, Lucila has added some vegetables to sell to the people in their village.

Lucila wants to extend the products she sells to her customers and add some more vegetables and commodities to sell. Hence, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks and vegetables to sell. She believes that availing herself of the loan will have a positive impact on her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam is fifty-seven years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. To support her family, Nam earns an income by selling rice. She started this business twenty-two years ago. 

She would like to take a loan to expand her current business. With the loan, she will buy more varieties of rice of better quality, which will enable her to attract additional customers. 

Nam hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living condition and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy more varieties of rice to sell.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Hiep's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop to sell charcoal in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is requesting a new loan to buy fabric and materials. Loan's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials.

loans.name: Juliter

texts.en:
Juliter is a single woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated a grocery business, selling as wholesale and retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' needs in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase tomatoes, onions and green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions and green vegetables.

loans.name: Betina

texts.es:
La señora Betina tiene 55 años de edad, es separada desde hace varios años, ella vive en la ciudad de Encarnación.  Betina es comerciante desde hace más de 10 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas y tiene su puesto en el Circuito Comercial de la ciudad de Encarnación, tiene mucha clientela ya que se encuentra situada en una zona bastante circulada por turistas y personas de la zona. Gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido educar a sus hijos que hoy día ya son adultos, puede mantener el hogar y cubrir los gastos necesarios.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de más ropa interior para damas, para surtir su puesto de ventas, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Betina, 55, has been separated for several years.  She lives in the city of Encarnación.  Betina’s been a merchant for more than ten years.  She sells women’s underwear in a stand in the city of Encarnación’s commercial circuit.  She has a large clientele because she’s located in a spot that’s visited by many tourists and locals.  Thanks to this activity she’s been able to educate her children who today are all adults.  She’s able to support her home and cover necessary expenses.  She asks for the loan to buy more underwear for woman to stock her stand which will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy women's underwear to sell.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao would like to take a further loan to buy more pigs and repair her piggery. Thao's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and repair her piggery.

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.es:
El Sr. Bienvanido es cliente antiguo de la fundación Paraguaya, el mismo es casado y  vive en su casa propia en la ciudad de Luque. Bienvenido tiene una joyería en la ciudad de Luque desde el año 1986 y su negocio es más que conocido por los que viven en esa ciudad.
El es un señor muy trabajador y nos comenta que gracias a los años que lleva en este trabajo y sumado a eso la buena calidad y belleza de sus joyas ha podido ir creciendo y de esa forma ir ayudando a su familia.
El solicita el crédito para poder surtir su negocio con más variedad de joyas, lo cual le será de gran ayuda pues tiene pedidos con los cuales les gustaría poder cumplir. Agradece la ayuda recurrente que le está dando la fundación pues eso le ha ayudado mucho.
texts.en:
Bienvenido is a longstanding Fundación Paraguaya client.  He’s married and lives in his own house in the city of Luque.  Bienvenido has had a jewelry store in the city of Luque since 1986 and it’s quite well known by city residents.

He is a very hardworking man who comments that thanks to the years he’s been in business he’s been able to grow and be able to help his family this way.

He’s asking for the loan to stock his store with more jewelry which will be of great help to him because he has pending orders he’d like to be able to fill.  

He is grateful for the recurring support the Fundación has been giving him because it’s helped him quite a bit.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Scolasticah

texts.en:
Scolasticah is a widowed woman with five children, all attending school. She operates a poultry business, and has been in the business for five years. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She sells her goods both from home and at the market. 

Scolasticah plans to use the KES 40000 to buy chicks for her business. The high transportation cost of poultry feed is her major drawback, and she describes school fees to be her greatest monthly expense. She joined Yehu to get capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is thirty-nine years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Gemma has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. 

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of shampoo, canned goods, breads and beverages.

loans.name: Hiram

texts.en:
Hiram is twenty-three years old single and with no dependents.  He sells second hand clothes and shoes, a business he started four years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He has requested a loan worth KES 25,000 to purchase a bale of shirts and and a bale of shoes to sell. The anticipated profit will contribute towards him buying a car for a taxi business. 

He dreams of improving his living standards. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase a bale each of shirts and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical bills.

For the past year, she has operated a fruit selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, healthcare, and clothing.

For the past the two years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing products. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and potatoes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is forty-two years old, married to Catherine, and blessed with five children aged eighteen, sixteen, fourteen, eleven and eight. He is a farmer, a practice he ventured into four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES 25,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the planting season. The profit he makes will help him repay his loan and expand his business. 

His dream is to be successful in the future. This is his second loan.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the planting season.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a fifty-one-year-old man with five children, none of whom is enrolled in school. He has been selling fruits at the market for the last three years. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  His major challenge is high transportation costs, and he spends a lot on food during the month.

He intends to use the KES 20000 to expand his business by buying mangoes, oranges, and coconuts. Francis joined Yehu to get loans for his business. He aspires to be a prominent business man in the area.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying mangoes, oranges, and coconuts.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is thirty-three years of age. She has been blessed with two school-age children. Her big dream is to provide them with a good education so one day they can have a good employment. Arlene and her spouse help each other to provide for the needs of her children. Currently, Arlene has a small variety store in their house as a source of income.

She wants to add to the stock in her store in order to provide her clientele with a variety of goods to choose. As a result, Arlene is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, candies, milk and shampoo. She is hoping that her request for a loan will be approved in order to enhance her profit.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies, milk and shampoo.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a nursery school for the kindergarten kids. She dreams of expanding the school to accommodate more children in the future. 

With the loan of Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase chairs for the school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chairs for the school.

loans.name: Orpah

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Orpah is married and blessed with a ten-year-old son whom she supports. She sells fish, a business she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 20,000 to purchase more fish for sale. The profit earned from the business will help her repay her loan. Her dream is to see her business expand to greater levels. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a fifty-four-year-old married woman with two children, none of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Susan has been selling fruits for the last three years, and describes poor transport infrastructure as the major challenge. 

She intends to use the KES 25,000 to add an additional stock of fruit to her business. She sells her fruits both from home and at the market. Susan joined Yehu to access cheap loans, and her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: to add an additional stock of fruit to her business.

loans.name: Kevins

texts.en:
Kevins is twenty-seven years old, single, and with no dependents. He owns a wholesale stall selling tomatoes in Kitale main market. He started this business four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase additional crates of tomatoes to sell. The anticipated profit will help him start farming tomatoes in addition to buying and selling. 

He dreams of buying a lorry to ferry his goods to the market rather than hiring vehicles for transportation. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional crates of tomatoes.

loans.name: Carmilita

texts.en:
Carmilita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Carmilita has a shop that sells/retails fuel gas. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy plenty of fuel gas to sell.

Carmilita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy plenty of gas to sell.

loans.name: Meguelito

texts.en:
Meguelito is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child. 

Meguelito is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Meguelito has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and tools for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Activas" esta en el 1º ciclo, surgió gracias a promociones que se hicieron en el barrio. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y con gran espíritu de lucha y emprendedurismo. Su meta es poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa. 
La Sra. Eladia, es la Presidenta del grupo, ella orienta a sus compañeras a luchar por sus objetivos mediante la buena utilización del crédito. Ella es peluquera y también repostera, nos comenta que siempre está con muchos pedidos de todos sus clientes, y que gracias a Dios, el trabajo no le falta. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, spray y demás insumos que pueda necesitar para poder seguir trabajando. Ella y su grupo están muy contentas por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) committee is in its first cycle.  It arose thanks to promotional activities in their neighborhood.  They are very hardworking people with great fighting and enterprising spirits.  Their goal is to reach the program’s highest level.

Eladia is group president.  She guides her fellow members to strive towards their objectives by managing their credit well.  She is a barber and also a pastry chef.  She comments that she always has many customer orders and thanks be to God she always has work.

She requested the loan to buy shampoo, rinse, hair coloring, spray and other supplies she may need to be able to continue working.  She and her group are very happy for the opportunity they are getting from Kiva and from Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is fifty-nine years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Esperanza works very hard to provide for them.

Esperanza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Esperanza has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, noodles, eggs, snack foods, etc.

In the future Esperanza would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Kenedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is aged twenty-seven and married with three children aged between six and one. He has been meeting his family's daily needs from the income he makes from farming and by selling produce like milk, maize, beans and poultry. He gets additional income from livestock trade.

Kenedy has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his poultry farming by buying more birds. He also hopes to get into the dairy breeding business in five years time. He adds that his focus is to make farming his core business and to be able to educate his children to higher levels.

He mentions fluctuation in market prices and animal diseases as the major challenges.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Vecitacion

texts.en:
Vecitacion is sixty-three years old and widowed with seven children.

Vecitacion is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Vecitacion requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs.

Vecitacion has been hog-raising for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vecitacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: Domingo is 53 years old, and is married to Petrocinia who takes care of their six children. They live in the village of Cutog Grande. The primary source of income for the family comes from raising hogs. Domingo has been engaged in his business for many years and earns about PHP 7,000 per hog when it is disposed. Domingo is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccine, and an additional hog to raise. He hopes to grow his business and earn more profits to secure his family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and an additional hog to raise.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
Este comité es un grupo muy activo y unido, el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo 8º, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, sustentos de sus casas. Ellas luchan arduamente por sus hijos y sus familiares, para darles lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ninguna privación. 
La Sra. Irene  es miembro del grupo,  ella tiene una fábrica de jabones en donde ella misma los fabrica en compañía de su marido y sus hijos que siempre estuvieron con ella en todo y gracias al tiempo que lleva en esto va creciendo con su esfuerzo y también gracias a la  Fundación Paraguaya. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes que glicerina, aromatizantes, colorantes y demás insumos necesarios para poder seguir elaborando los jabones que vende. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
This committee is a very active, united group that’s in its 8th cycle.  They are female heads of household who are the sole support of their homes.  They strive hard for their children and families to give them what they need so that they won’t lack anything.

Irene is a group member.  She has a soap factory where she herself manufactures it with her husband and children who have always been with her in everything.  Because of the time she’s been in this she’s been growing thanks to her efforts and also thanks to Fundación Paraguaya.

She requested the loan to buy ingredients like glycerin, scents, dyes and other supplies needed to continue making the soaps she sells.  She is grateful for the opportunity she’s getting from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy glycerin, scents, dyes and other supplies.

loans.name: Blandina

texts.en:
This is Blandina, forty-six, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Renerio, her business partner, and she is a mother of two children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Blandina operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, factories and others of the like. Aside from this she also raises pigs in her compound. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 26,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Blandina hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business; she also hopes that they serve the lord. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her business.

Presentacion has been in this business for four years. Presentacion earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Presentacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married and has three children. She is 44 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rosa is a farmer and owns a rubber plantation to earn a living. She has been doing this for 26 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase materials needed for her rubber plantation.

Rosa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her land to plant more rubber.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her rubber plantation.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 42 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Regina works very hard to provide for them.

Regina runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Regina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, eggs, etc.

In the future, Regina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca (fiber from abaca palm leaf, used for handicraft production) weaving business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

She has been in this business for eleven years.

In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Kuña Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Kuña oñondivepa se llama el grupo integrado por 14 mujeres de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que han visto en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya una gran ayuda para ellas y para sus hijos y familiares. 
Lidia se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser prendas nuevas y usadas. Comenta que gracias a este negocio ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles para poder sobrellevar el día a día.  Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante y seguir ayudando a su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y de esa forma ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Ellas agradecen a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
“Kuña Oñondivepa” is the name of this group of 14 women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  They are female heads of household who see in Fundación Paraguaya’s enterprising women’s program a great help for them and for their children and families.

Lidia works selling all types of clothes both new and used.  She comments that thanks to this business she’s been able to help her family and give them what they need to survive each day.  She defines herself as a very hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead and continue helping her family.

She requests the loan to buy all types of clothes to continue working and offering more variety to her customers.  

They all are grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for the opportunity they are getting.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
