Este Banco comunal se llama “Esperanza de Punta Mira” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa usada, venta de bolsos, venta de ropa deportiva, perfumería, repostería, amasandería, preparación de ensaladas y costuras, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Coquimbo.
Sara presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda. Ella viste un chaleco largo color beige, sus pantalones son de color negro y también usa una cartera negra cruzada al pecho. Su cabello es color cano y además usa anteojos.
Ella se dedica a la distribución de gas licuado, desde hace 9 años. Comenta que una de las motivaciones de comenzar con el negocio, se debió a la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos para costear los estudios superiores de su hija.
Su distribuidora la instaló en el terreno de su casa y su hijo es quien la ayuda a repartir el gas.
Comenta que el horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo, en horario completo.
Su clientela es fija, por tanto la conserva desde que comenzó el negocio.
Sus galones de gas los compra directamente en las sucursales de la marca de gas licuado por la cual trabaja.
Con el crédito comprará una mayor cantidad de galones de gas para invertir en su negocio y de ésta manera espera generar mayores ingresos.
Una de sus metas es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, al igual que la fachada de su distribuidora, ya que estos arreglos le permitirían captar una mayor cantidad de clientes. Aprovechando la concurrencia de gente en el sector comercial en el cual está ubicado su local.
Sara vive junto a su madre, quien está bajo su cuidado, además de su hija, quien se encuentra en proceso de titulación en la carrera de Obras Civiles.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio con un mayor capital. Además comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy unido y comprometido. Situación que la mantiene conforme y contenta. 
Coquimbo es una ciudad-puerto y por otro lado comuna-balneario, capital de la provincia de Elqui, IV Región de Coquimbo, Chile. La economía de la zona se basa principalmente en la minería ya que posee grandes yacimientos de magnesio, oro, plata, cobre, hierro y plomo. También hay agricultura que se desarrolla gracias al intensivo uso de los valles de Elqui, Limarí y Choapa con cultivos de hortalizas y frutas favorecidos por las condiciones del clima.
texts.en:
This communal bank called, "Esperanza de Punta Mira," [Hope of Punta Mira] is made up of 19 entrepreneurs, who are dedicated to different businesses.  Among them are clothing, purse, athletic clothing, and perfume sales; a bakery; salad preparation; sewing; etc.  All of them live in the city of Coquimbo.

Sara is the president of the communal bank.  In the photo, she is in the front row, second from the right.  She has on a long beige sweater, black pants, and a black purse.  Her hair is gray and she is wearing glasses.  She has made a living selling liquid gas for 9 years.  She tells us that one of her motivations for starting her business was the need to generate income to pay for her daughter's higher education costs.

Her business is located on her property, and her son helps her deliver the gas.  She tells us that she works full-time from Monday-Sunday.  She has a fixed clientele, which she has kept since she started her business.  She buys her gallons of gas directly from a branch of the gas brand with which she works.  With this loan, she will buy a larger quantity of gallons of gas to invest in her business.  In this way, she hopes to generate more income. One of her goals is to improve the infrastructure of her business as well as the exterior of her distributorship, since these repairs will let her attract a larger number of customers by taking advantage of the number of people who pass through the commercial area where her business is located.

Sara lives with her mother, for whom she cares, and her daughter, who is working towards her degree in public works.  She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza.  This credit will let her invest in her business with more capital.  She also says that her communal bank is very united and committed.  This makes her satisfied and happy.

Coquimbo is a port city and is located on the beach.  It is the capital of the Elqui province, in the region of Coquimbo, Chile.  The economy in the area is based primarily on mining since it has large magnesium, gold, silver, copper, iron, and lead deposits.  Agriculture is also practiced thanks to the extensive farming in the Elqui, Limarí, and Choapa valleys.  Vegetables and fruits that thrive in this climate are grown here.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of gallons of gas to invest in her business so she can hopefully generate more income.

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania,el socio vende tejidos y ceramicas,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania.El socio solicita el credito para comprar mantas y ceramicos al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues working in the business of craftsmanship. He is selling fabrics and ceramics. The borrower through this business wants to get ahead. His dream is to expand the business of selling handicrafts.

The member is asking for a loan in order to buy blankets and ceramics at wholesale prices.

This member is happy for the loan and he promises to complete his payments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy blankets and ceramics at wholesale prices

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupement JESUKPEGO est composé de treize personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Cécile est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Cécile est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Cécile a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Cécile ne vit plus avec son mari, mais a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Cécile vit donc seule avec ses trois enfants et assure leurs différents besoins grâce aux revenus de son activité.Il y a environs vingt cinq ans que Cécile vend des poulets, des escargots et des produits alimentaires de façon secondaire dans sa région. Cécile s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Cécile sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement JESUKPEGO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group JESUKPEGO comprises thirteen persons who live in the same district. This is the third time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, Cécile, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 38 years old and lives in Benin. Cécile halted her studies in primary school. She no longer lives with her husband but has three children, all in school and in her care. So she lives alone with her three children and ensures their different needs are covered, thanks to the revenues from her business. 

For about 25 years, Cécile has been selling chickens, snails, and grocery items on the side in her region. She gets her supplies from regions in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, Cécile is requesting, along with the other members of your group JESUKPEGO, a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy hens and various items (food).

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, vice présidente du groupe de crédit  Dunda mu Yesu, Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 30 ans. Elle est  vendeuse de haricots. Elle fait également la coupe couture. Son mari est Enseignant dans une école primaire. Il ya  2 ans qu’elle  fait le petit commerce. Plus tard, elle fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour renforcer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  7eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  d’acheter 2 sacs de haricots.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une parcelle dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
This client is the vice-president of the loan group Dunda mu Yesu. An energetic women and an entrepreneur, she is 30 years old and a seller of beans. She also makes clothing. Her husband is a teacher in a primary school. 

She has had a small business for two years.  Later, she was informed about microloans granted by the microfinance institution Hekima. She then benefited from her first loan of $50 to bolster her work. The profits from her business go toward savings, food, and support for her children's schooling. However, she just received her seventh loan. During the time period, this client saw that her business clearly prospered. So she decided to increase the loan amount for this new cycle. This new loan must serve to buy 2 sacks of beans for her. 

In addition, she wishes to see her children grow up and buy a plot of land in the future. 

This client thanks Hekima for its actions helping poor women with low incomes to become autonomous.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of beans

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia se seigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cereales,la socia vende trigo,cebada,habas y maiz,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de cereales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar trigo,cebada y habas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Gregoria continues to make a living by selling grains:  wheat, barley, broad beans, and corn.  She works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  Through this business, she wants to get ahead.  Her dream is to expand her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy wheat, barley and broad beans wholesale.  She is happy about this loan, and she promises to make all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy wheat, barley, and broad beans wholesale.

loans.name: Amana

texts.fr: Amana est une femme de 35ans.  Elle est veuve et a en charge 02enfants dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 22ans et le dernier 18ans. Elle est revendeuse de céréales (mil, maïs, sorgho…) depuis 12ans.  Elle vend à domicile et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter des sacs de céréales supplémentaires. Elle veut faire accroitre son activité et avoir son propre magasin. Elle veut subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Amana is a 35 years old woman who is a widow with two children to support. One of the children is in school. The first child is 22 years old, and the last is 18. Amana has been a retailer of grain (millet, corn, sorghum, …) for twelve years. She sells out of her home and gets her supplies in Lomé. She is requesting this initial loan to buy extra sacks of grain. She wants to grow her business and have her own store. She wants to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy grain

loans.name: Jose Reyes

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 53 años de edad, es separado y tiene un hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con el último de sus hijos pues los demás son independientes, en el asentamiento humano Víctor Raúl Haya de La Torre, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Su comunidad tiene instinto de superación, pero sólo cuentan con servicio de luz eléctrica.
La actividad a la que se dedica José es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, caprino y aves de corral, los cuales engorda para luego comercializarlos en el Centro Poblado de Cruceta. Además, realiza labores de agricultura que le generan ingresos semanales para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
El monto del préstamo es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para la compra de alimentos para el ganado que tiene y que comercializará pronto.
texts.en:
José is a 53 year old man, separated and has a son in his care. He lives in his own house with the last of his children as the others are adults. He lives in the Víctor Raúl Haya de La Torre settlement, in the district of Tambogrande. His community has the desire to improve, as it has only electricity service.

José’s activity is breeding and selling sheep, goats and poultry, which he fattens for later sale in Centro Poblado de Cruceta. In addition, he works in agriculture, generating a weekly income in order to cover household expenses.

The 1000 soles from the loan proceeds will be used to buy animal feed for his livestock which he will put on the market soon.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for his livestock

loans.name: Lydia Junieth

texts.es: Lydia Junieth es una emprendedora se le ha apoyado para invertir en el negocio en la compra  de productos para sus clientes ya tiene pedidos que sus clientes le hacen, esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante. Esta emprendedora ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en el cual en el crédito otorgado ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con muchos deseos de superación, actualmente está solicitando crédito para comprar pantalones, zapatos, cosméticos, ropa y sabanas, camisas, sandalias entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Lydia Junieth is an entrepreneur who has been supported so that she can invest in her business by buying products for her clients since she has orders to fill for her customers. She conducts her business as a traveling salesperson. She has been working with Fundación León 2000 where she received a loan and demonstrated that she is a responsible person who greatly wants to succeed.

Currently Lydia Junieth is applying for a loan to buy pants, shoes, cosmetics, clothing and sheets, shirts and sandals, among other items.

loans.use: to buy pants, shoes, cosmetics, clothing and sheets, shirts and sandals among other items.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia Edith pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO", lel banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito se San Jeronimo en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua alternando sus actividades diarias con la compra y venta de bebidas alcoholicas; la socia distribuye piscos a sus clientes que le solicitan como markets,tiendas ,entre otros,la socia es una persona empeñosa con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando por su familia,la socia desea que su negocio cresca en el futuro.

La socia invertira el prestamo en la compra de pisco al por mayor para de esta manera tener mas mercaderia que ofrecer a sus clientes.

 
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
Edith belongs to the "Las Leonas de San Jeronimo" communal bank, located in San Jeronimo district in Cusco department.

The borrower is still alternating her daily activities with the purchase and sale of alcoholic beverages. She distributes piscos (traditional Peruvian grape brandy) to her customers who ask her for it, such as minimarts, stores, and other places. 

The borrower is a determined person, who is very eager to keep working for her family. She wishes to see her business grow in the future.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of pisco at wholesale, in order to have more merchandise to offer her customers.
 
The borrower is happy about the loan she has been granted, and grateful to the Kiva investors.

loans.use: To buy pisco (traditional Peruvian grape brandy) at wholesale.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de sandalias y babuchas,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de sandalias y babuchas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar sandalias y babuchas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to sell sandals and shoes and hopes to get ahead through this profession. She works from 9:00 a.m until 5:00 p.m. Her dream is to expand her business.

Gladis is requesting this loan to buy sandals and shoes. She is pleased to have the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy sandals and shoes.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa has been selling kenkey for four years now in Mbeam, near Abura, using her income to pay her utility bills. Adowa is requesting this loan to purchase more kenkey to sell, and with the new profits from her expanded business, she will produce the kenkey herself.

loans.use: to purchase more kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Amistad Y Progreso - Pincha Group

texts.es:
La Sr. TOMASA de 45 años de edad casada, siempre carismática y emprendedora del grupo, actualmente es socia en la alcancía comunal, “AMISTAD Y PROGRESO - PINCHA” grupo conformado por 08 personas. 
TOMASA  tiene su restaurante de ventas de comidas en un local alquilada cerca al mercado de su localidad, desde muy tempranas horas  del día realiza sus compras para su preparación de sus comidas.  
El préstamo solicito para la compra de mesas y sillas, ya que está incrementando la cantidad de clientes. 
Sus objetivos para el futuro es apertura otro restaurantes. Ella se ubicada en la fotografía tercera persona lado derecha viste con camiseta color blanco y chompa color rosada.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 45, married, and always a charming, enterprising member of the group. She is one of 8 members of the communal bank Amistad y Progreso - Pincha. Tomasa rents a restaurant space near her local market. She rises very early to purchase the supplies she needs to prepare her food.  

This loan will be used to purchase tables and chairs because her clientele is growing. Her goal is to open other restaurants. Tomasa, wearing a white t-shirt and pink vest, is the third person on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Lucy S.

texts.en:
Lucy, thirty-three, lives in Logan Town with her husband and two school-going children aged eight and fifteen. She and her husband have been running a grocery shop where they sell rice, soda and soft drinks, oil, mineral water and other items to make meals. She says that the business allows them to send their children to school. She says they started this business doing plaiting and hairdressing in her community. 

She is requesting the loan to buy more rice, oil, mineral water, soda and soft drinks for her business. Her plans are to expand her business even more and in the future she would like to see her children finish high-school and attending college.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, mineral water, soda and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Jhonny Jans

texts.es:
Jhonny es un joven muy trabajador, humilde y sobre todo con mucho optimismo, vive junto a sus padres, a los cuales apoya con mucho cariño ya que tienen una edad avanzada y necesitan de muchos cuidados, asimismo junto a él vive también su hermana a la cual apoya mucho en especial con sus estudios; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es muy conocido porque allí se encuentra uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual son las Islas Ballestas y el gran candelabro de Paracas. Como buen peruano ama la comida de nuestro país por ello uno de sus paltos favoritos es el riquísimo Arroz Chaufa”, debido a los pocos recursos económicos que tenían sus padres el solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería Civil.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de Caldo de gallina, el se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 12 horas al día, especialmente en las noches es donde tienen más publico en su negocio ya que mayormente se acercan los choferes de taxi y los trabajadores del campo; puede atender en el día alrededor de 40 clientes, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tienen mucha fe en Dios y por ello tiene trabajo.

Jhonny está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ay que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá realizar la compra de un televisor para su local de venta de caldo de gallina, lo que le ayudara a que los clientes se sientan mas cómodos y aumentar el número de clientes, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres y hermana, así el seguirá luchando cada día para salir adelante y poder realizar su más grande sueño:” Tener su casas propia”
texts.en:
Jhonny is a very hard-working, modest young man. Above all, he is very optimistic.  He lives with his parents, whom he lovingly supports, as they are elderly and need a lot of care. Also living with him are his sister, whom he helps a great deal, especially with her education. 

Their home is located in Pisco, a city known for its warm and inviting climate. It is also well known because some of the most important tourist attractions in the country are located there: the Ballestas Islands and the Great Candelabra of Paracas. 

As a good Peruvian he loves our country's food, and one of his favorite dishes is the very delicious "Arroz Chaufa" (Peruvian-style Chinese Fried Rice). Due to his parent's lack of financial resources, he only went as far as high school, but he would have liked to have studied Civil Engineering.

With much effort, and especially through saving, he managed to start his business selling chicken soup. He works in his business around 12 hours a day, especially in the evenings when he has more customers in his place, as he mostly serves taxi drivers and farmworkers. He can serve around 40 customers a day. He believes that his business is doing well because he has a lot of faith in God, and this is why he has work.

Jhonny is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the support they have provided him, he will be able to purchase a television for his chicken soup place. This will help him to have his customers feel more comfortable, and to increase his clientele. This way he will be able to improve his income, and improve the quality of life for his parents and sister. This way he will keep struggling every day to succeed and to realize his greatest dream: "To have his own house."

loans.use: To buy a television for his eatery.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is married and the mother of three from northern Israel. She works part time at the post office, but for several years, she has studied hair styling and makeup artistry. She opened a small salon in her home and is working to expand her business and increase her income. She is determined to create a prosperous business.

Sanaa needed this loan to purchase equipment, chairs for two hair-cutting stations, hair-coloring supplies, cosmetics, professional scissors, combs and brushes.

Sanaa wants to continue to expand her business. After years of investing in her skills, she wants to see her salon flourish. She is determined to create a prosperous business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment, chairs, hair coloring supplies, cosmetics, professional scissors, combs and brushes.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en: For as long as she can remember, Adriana has been determined to own her own business. Two years ago, she saw this dream come true when she founded her home-based wholesale jewelry company in Miami, Florida. Her company primarily specializes in the sale of stainless steel jewelry. Ever since the founding of her company, she has loved the independence it has given her and she has seen overwhelming success. This success has inspired her to diversify her company into an individual seller of jewelry as well as a wholesaler. She also hopes that, through new business permits, she will be able to diversify the products that she sells to become a more well-rounded retailer and serve a larger variety of customers. Adriana is asking for this loan to help her purchase a larger inventory for future sales.

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of jewelry for resale

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: Oscar has lived in the United States for 11 years and has worked a variety of jobs, most recently as a bank teller. However, recently after speaking with a friend, Oscar saw the perfect opportunity to fulfill a dream and start his own business. Late last year, Oscar founded his own carrier business and soon after landed a large daily loading contract that allowed his business to thrive. Seeing almost immediate success, Oscar now looks to grow his business and help the local economy. His ultimate goals in creating this business are to provide for himself through independent means and create jobs. He has a commitment to grow his business and help joblessness in his own community, as well as on a larger scale. This loan will help his business grow by providing funds to support an office and the hiring of an additional employee.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to set up an office and to hire a new employee

loans.name: Galindo Group

texts.es: Miguel, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Galindo, tiene 26 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hijo, el es una persona muy luchadora y conocida en la comunidad. Desde que era niño soñaba con tener su propio negocio, Miguel se dedica a la caficultura y desde hace seis años inicio con una pequeña pulpería, la que ha ido surtiendo poco a poco, en la cual trabaja en conjunto con su esposa y tienen un  horario de atención de 6:00 am a 8:00 pm. Una de sus desventajas es que en algunos meses las ventas bajan pero con la buena administración del negocio Miguel y su esposa han podido salir adelante. Su familia es de muy escasos recursos económicos y por lo tanto aprovechan cada oportunidad que se les presenta. Así que el préstamo que solicita lo necesita para surtir la pulpería con la compra de productos como ser: arroz, harina, huevos, azúcar, manteca, jabón, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este préstamo Miguel podrá mantener su negocio bien surtido y así ayudar con el sostenimiento de su familia, una de sus metas es hacer crecer su negocio. Miguel tiene tres ciclos de ser cliente de FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Miguel is a member of the communal bank, "Galindo."  He is 26, married, and has 1 son.  He is a determined person and is well-known in the community.  Since he was a boy, he dreamed about having his own business.  Miguel makes a living growing coffee, and 6 years ago, he started his own small grocery store.  He has stocked it little by little.  He works with his wife, and they have a schedule from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m.  One of the disadvantages is that in some months, the sales are lower, but with good administration of the business, Miguel and his wife have been able to get ahead.  Their family has scarce economic resources, so they make the most of each opportunity that presents inself.  The loan that he is requesting is to stock his grocery store with products like:  rice, flour, eggs, sugar, butter, soap, etc.  With the help of this loan, Miguel will be able to keep his business well-stocked and help support his family.  One of his goals is to grow his business.  This is Miguel's third loan with FAMA, and he has paid off his previous loans on time.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Jenniffer Beatriz

texts.es:
Jenniffer es una madre soltera de 24 años, sus dos hijos tienen 1 y 3 años y juntos viven en la parroquia "Río Verde" en "Santo Domingo" que es un cantón de la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" el cual es uno de los más densamente poblados del Ecuador. Tiene un gran atractivo ya que posee varios monumentos distribuidos por toda la ciudad entre el que está el Monumento al Indio Colorado, sector conocido como la “Y del Colorado”.  Santo Domingo es un cantón privilegiado, con gente maravillosa, trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha incansablemente por el desarrollo y progreso, que recibe al turista siempre con los brazos abiertos y los lleva a conocer lo maravilloso de su cultura y entorno. 

Jenniffer es propietaria de un salón de belleza desde hace 8 años. Se ha sabido ganar a su clientela gracias a que ama su trabajo. Es difícil combinar el trabajo con la maternidad, sin embargo ella ha sabido hacer las dos cosas de la mejor manera. Los muebles e implementos de su salón de belleza ya necesitan renovarse, por lo que Jenniffer se acercó a Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre ella y KIVA, para solicitar los recursos económicos que tanta falta le hacen. Este es su segundo crédito con esta institución, nos comenta que le gustan las facilidades y la amabilidad con la que es atendida; Jenniffer se ha destacado por sus pagos puntuales.

Su sueño es tener una casa propia, en la cual pueda dar mayor comodidad a sus hijos y con esta inversión espera atraer mayor clientela y con ello mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jenniffer is a 24-year-old single mother whose two children are 1 and 3 years old. They live together in Río Verde Parish in Santo Domingo, which is a canton in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province--one of the most densely populated provinces in Ecuador. Beautiful monuments have been placed throughout the city; one of these is Monumento al Indio Colorado [Monument to the Red Indian, a historic reference to the dyed hair of the Tsáchila people] in an area known as Y del Colorado. Santo Domingo is a unique canton, with wonderful, enterprising people who work tirelessly for development and progress and always welcome tourists with open arms and take them to see the wonders of their culture and surroundings. 

Jenniffer has been the owner of a beauty salon for the past 8 years. She has won over clients because she loves her work. Being a working mother is difficult; however, she has learned how to manage as well as she can. She needs to update her furniture and replace her styling tools and has come to Fundación Alternativa, which is the intermediary between Jenniffer and KIVA, to request the financing she needs. This is her second loan with this institution. She told us that she likes the payment arrangements and the friendly service she receives. Jenniffer has been on time with her payments.

Her dream is to have her own home where she can make her children more comfortable. With this investment, she hopes to attract more clients, to have more income, and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a chair and styling tools to upgrade her salon.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando a sus estudios y de esta manera poder salir adelante y seguir estudiando para que pueda ser profesional,el sueño de la socia es poder trabajar en la especialidad de su carrera profesional.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un artefacto como un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is still working on her studies in order to be able to get ahead and keep studying to be a professional.  This member's dream is to be able to work professionally in her field.  She is asking for this loan to buy an appliance for her home, such as a television.

This member is very happy because of her loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy an appliance for her home, such as a television

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en: Carlos owns and operates his own media, film, and TV production company out of his home in Miami, Florida. He produces commercials, novels, and other TV shows in conjunction with some of the largest Latin American television stations in the United State and abroad. He has been running this business for over a year and has seen significant and consistent growth that has allowed him to hire two employees. Over the past few years, Miami has become a hub for the Latin American television industry in the United States. Carlos is well aware of this trend, hopes to use it to continue the growth of his business and knows that it will provide a constant stream of work. However, to make his business more appealing, he needs to update his equipment. He is asking for this loan to upgrade his camera and microphone for filming.

loans.use: to upgrade his camera and microphone for filming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to raise the roof and to build a room in her house.

loans.name: Señor De Coylloriti Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Señor De Coylloriti” en el distrito del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por doce personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de las socias son por ejemplo; venta de productos de primera necesidad, venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de anticuchos, venta de cosméticos, venta y compra de boletos turísticos, venta de manjar y otros brindan servicios. 
 
(La señora Ana está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Ana nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, tiene 60 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene ocho hijos. Su actividad económica principal de Ana es la venta de Anticuchos de forma ambulatoria en su barrio. En esta oportunidad Ana requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne, papa y aceite para preparar anticuchos. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

(La socia que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía llego después de la reunión).
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the “Senor de Coylloriti” communal bank in the district of Cusco. The communal bank is composed of a dozen people who are always searching for opportunities to get ahead, and with their daily efforts, to provide a better future for their children. The members' economic activities are, for example; selling products of primary necessity, clothing, meals, kebabs, cosmetics, delicacies, and buying and selling tourist tickets, plus other services. 
 
Ana, who is raising her hand in the photograph, was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born. She is 60 years old, married, and 8 children are the fruit of this union. Ana's principal economic activity is selling kebabs on the street of her neighborhood. On this occasion, Ana needs a loan to buy supplies; for example, meat, potatoes, and oil to prepare kebabs. 

The members in general are grateful for the loan opportunity offered and they commit themselves to making their payments as scheduled.

Cusco is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco, right in the heart of the ancient city of the Incas. It is characterized as a tourist zone with its archaeological and historical centers, its landscapes and its history, and for being an enchanting city in the Southern Region of the country.  Cusco is also known as a very touristy and commercial zone, and famous for its traditional fiesta of Inti Raymi, and because, nearby, one encounters Macchu Picchu, one of the 7 wonders of the world.

(The member who appears at the bottom of the photograph arrived after the meeting.)

loans.use: buy supplies such as meat, potatoes, and oil to prepare kebabs to sell.

loans.name: Mirna Tatiana

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente del Cantón Sucre cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mirna, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 23 y 17 años de edad, la menor estudia en colegio, ambos viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.
 
Ella para obtener algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de mariscos, ventas que realiza en su casa lugar en el cual tiene un pequeño pero bien surtido local, en su negocio los clientes encuentran del todo ya que ella les ofrece: camarón, langostinos, cangrejos, pescado en muchas variedades, conchas, entre otras cosas y todas de muy buena calidad ya que esta es su garantía y es por esto que sus clientes la prefieren, lleva más de  20 años  con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar mariscos en todas las especies y darles a sus clientes lo mejor. Está en el en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio  y le gusta porque sus compañeras son unidas y confiables. 

Su sueño es tener un gran frigorífico en el centro de Portoviejo.
texts.en:
The 1 de Diciembre Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the seaside town of San Clemente in the canton of Sucre.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many tourists from other parts of the country and abroad.  It offers a diversity of beautiful locations and a rich variety of traditional dishes from the region.

This is where we met Mirna.  She is 41 years old, married, and has two children from this marriage who are 23 and 17 years old.  The youngest is in high school and both of them live at home.  Her husband is a shopkeeper.

In order to make some money on her own and to be able to help with the household expenses, she sells seafood for a living.  She sells from her home, where she has a small, but well stocked stand.  Her customers find everything at her business, as she offers shrimp, lobster, crab, many kinds of fish, and conch, among other things.  Everything is of very good quality because she guarantees it and that's why her customers prefer her.  She has had her business for over 20 years and it's going very well for her.
 
This loan is to buy all kinds of seafood and to offer her customers the best.  She has been with her communal bank almost from its inception and she likes it because her fellow members are very close and reliable.

Her dream is to have a huge cold store in downtown Portoviejo.

loans.use: to buy seafood

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu sells fried yams, fish and chicken, which she has done for two years now. She lives together with her husband and five children at Mpohor near Takoradi.  Amadu uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility and accommodation bills. Amadu will use her loan to purchase yams, fish and chicken to fry and sell. With the new profit, Amadu will mount a better stall to sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase yams, fish and chicken to fry and sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is single and operates a grocery shop. This she has done for some years now. The items in her grocery store are different kinds of soft drinks, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, tin milk and others.  Ruth uses her income to pay her utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to satisfy her customers. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries

loans.name: Edmundo Americo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de licores,piscos y vinos,el socio tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de ropas como chompas,polos y casacas,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de licores y negocio de venta de ropa.El socio solicita el credito para comprar licores,piscos y vinos y tambien para comprar polos,chompas y casacas.

El socio  está contento con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
Edmundo is continuing to work as a distributor of liquors, piscos, and wines. He also has a business selling clothes such as sweaters, t-shirts, and jackets. His greatest wish is to expand his two businesses so he is seeking a loan to buy more liquor, piscos, and wines as well as clothing such as t-shirts, sweaters, and jackets. 

Edmundo is pleased with the loans he’s been granted and is grateful to Kiva’s donors.

loans.use: to buy liquor and clothing

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena lives together with her husband and six children in Mbeam near Abura. Her husband is a teacher. 

Abena produces soap for sale, which she has done for three years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. 

Abena will use the loan to purchase raw materials needed for making soap. With the new profit from her expanded business, Abena will produce in greater quantities.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed for making soap.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a long-time client of Asociación Arariwa. In her tenth year working with Arariwa, Julia is now 46 years old and married with three children. She dedicates herself to a business buying and selling grains such as quinoa, wheat, barley and corn. She purchases the products from farmers in Ocongate and sells them in Cusco and Sicuani, which are each about three hours away from Ocongate. Julia travels four times a month to transport merchandise. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more grains. She says that she dreams of having a nice house one day.

Julia is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Vallecito" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy grains such as quinoa, wheat, barley and corn.

loans.name: Justa

texts.en:
Justa has worked in the artisan sector for about six years, knitting and selling alpaca sweaters to wholesalers in Cusco. She presently employs one weaver to assist with production. Justa is requesting a loan in order to buy yarn. She is 38 years old and has two sons and one daughter with her partner. She says that she works in order to pay for her children’s education.

Justa is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Vallecito" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy yarn for knitting sweaters

loans.name: María Pamela

texts.es:
María Pamela es una joven casada con dos niños que se dedica al pequeño comercio como es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon y Zermat desde hace tres años. La idea de iniciar con este negocio fue para generar sus propios ingresos y ayudar con los gastos a su esposo en su hogar el cual le obsequió un pequeño capital para que iniciara a trabajar.
Pero hoy en la actualidad necesita de más capital para poder invertir en más productos ya que su demanda ha crecido por la facilidad de pago y los precios bajos los cuales ella ofrece a sus clientes.
Es por tal razón que se acercó por primera vez a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de bisutería, bloqueador, sombras, rubor, polvo compacto, pintura labial, cremas y perfumes con el objetivo de atraer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Pamela is a young married woman with two children. She has had a small business selling Avon and Zermat cosmetics for three years. She started the business with the idea of earning money and helping her husband with household expenses. He lent her a small amount of capital to get started.

Now María Pamela needs more money to buy more products as demand has increased because of the ease of payment and the low prices she offers her customers. For this reason she has approached Ceprodel for the first time for a loan to buy jewelry, sun cream, eye shadow, blush, face powder, lipsticks, creams and perfumes so she can attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Davaa is a 55-year-old man who lives with his wife and 3 children in Arhangai province in Central Mongolia. His wife is a retiree and his son studies at the college. Davaa used to work as a driver. After he retired he started making traditional boots based on his talent. He has been running the business for 8 years. During that time, he has made many regular customers, as wearing the boots has a lot of advantages especially in wintertime. He produces qualified traditional boots and sells them to the customers of the neighbor provinces. He has been earning and improving the household's livelihood. Davaa is a hardworking and talented man who says, "I would like to expand the boots production business by buying the necessary materials in large quantities. I plan to save for my son." The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy necessary materials for making boots.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for making boots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy meat and meat products.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married and has four children. She is 31 years old and resides at Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Maricel owns and operates a farm, where she plants and harvests rice for sale to earn a living. She has been five years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. 

In 2008, Maricel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a 41-year-old resident of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She provides her six children’s needs from the little amount of PHP 1,300 she gains monthly from her own piggery business. She has had the business for five years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. 

However, in 2010 she became a member of GDMPC. She is applying for a loan of PHP 3,000 at GDMPC Microfinance to buy feeding supplies. Elsie wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Jemmabelle

texts.en:
Jemmabelle is 27 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jemmabelle has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients, utensils, and other kitchenware for her restaurant.

Jemmabelle has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, utensils, and other kitchenware for her restaurant.

loans.name: Edgar Augusto

texts.es:
Edgar es un hombre de 25 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos a cargo. Vive en casa propia en el caserío Cachinche en el distrito de Mochumí. La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia la mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercialización de animales.

Edgar se dedica a la conducción de mototaxi y a la crianza y venta de ganado menor. Adicionalmente, realiza actividades relacionadas con la agricultura. Cuenta con experiencia de 3 años en el rubro de conducción. El negocio de venta de animales se realiza en su domicilio y ya cuenta con clientela fija.

Con el préstamo de 2500 nuevos soles se adquirirán más animales para crianza y alimentos para estos, así como para el mantenimiento de mototaxis.
texts.en:
Edgar is 25 years old, single, without dependent children. He lives in his own house in the village of Cachinche in the district of Mochumí. For their quality of life in the community and in order to survive the majority are self employed in the business of marketing animals.

Edgar works driving a motorcycle taxi and breeding and raising and selling small livestock. Additionally, he works in agricultural pursuits. He has three years experience as a driver. His animal business is done at home and he has regular customers.

With the loan of 2500 soles he will buy more animals for breeding and feed for them, and will use it also for the maintenance of his taxi.

loans.use: to buy livestock to expand his business

loans.name: Juana Rosario

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer muy emprendedora, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre de 2 preciosos hijos por los cuales ella trabaja muy duro y se esfuerza mucho cada día por salir adelante sola ya que el padre de sus pequeños se separo de ella ya hace algunos años; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es muy conocido porque allí se encuentra uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual son las Islas Ballestas y el gran candelabro de Paracas. 

Al inicio ella se dedicaba  a la venta de frutas,  pero con el pasar de los días las ventas bajaron y uno de sus pequeños se enfermo y tuvo que tomar el poco dinero que tenía como capital de su negocio para poder llevarlo a un médico; luego de lo sucedido empezó a ahorrar y con mucho esfuerzo Juana inicio su negocio de venta de Caldo de gallina, en su vivienda, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día en especial en las noches ya que hay mucha acogida en ese horario, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muy buena sazón y por ello los clientes siempre regresan.

Juana está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la gran ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar insumos para la preparación  de sus caldos como por ejemplo verdura al por mayor y realizar mejoras en su vivienda, lo que le permitirá darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y seguir luchando cada dia para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un gran restaurante y darle la mejor educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Juana is a very enterprising woman.  She is 37 years old and the mother of two adorable children for whom she works very hard.  She puts in a lot of effort every day to get ahead on her own, since the father of her little ones left her a few years ago.  Her home is in the city of Pisco, which is known for having a hot, comfortable climate.  It is also very well known because it is the site of one of the country's most important tourist attractions, the Ballestas Islands and Paracas' El Candelabro.

At first she sold fruit for a living, but as time went on, her sales went down and one of her little ones got sick and she had to use the little money she had for working capital to take him to the doctor.  After that happened, she began to save and, with a lot of effort, Juana started her business selling chicken soup in her home.  She works about eight hours a day, especially at night, since there is a lot of business at that time.  She thinks her business is going well because her seasoning is very good and that's why her customers always come back.

Juana is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to the great help she has received from them that she will be able to buy ingredients to make her soups, such as bulk vegetables.  She will also be able to make improvements to her home, which will allow her to offer her children a better quality of life and keep struggling every day to make her biggest dream a reality: to have a big restaurant and to offer her children the best education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (vegetables in bulk), and to pay for construction and finishing of her home

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has been operating a fish-vending business in the Philippines for four years. Now requesting a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg is a 43-year-old woman who lives with her husband, two sons and a daughter in Ulaanbaatar city in Mongolia. Her sons study at the secondary school and the daughter is employed. She has been selling packages of wood and coal at the trade center "21". She has been running her wood and coal retail business for 6 years. 

She also operates a construction materials trading business. Her husband helps to handle the business. She purchases the coal from the mining center and brings in the wood in large quantities. Battsetseg is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the coal and wood in large quantities. I am trying my best to improve our livelihood and save for my sons." The total amount she is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to buy more construction supplies for her business in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies.

loans.name: Joy Riz

texts.en:
Joy Riz is 31 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Joy Riz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, groceries, and other beverages and soft drinks.

She has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Joy Riz would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack food, groceries, and other beverages and soft drinks.

loans.name: Dulguun

texts.en:
Dulguun is a 28-year-old woman who lives with her husband and a daughter in a 'ger' (a traditional Mongolian tent) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her daughter is 1 year old. Dulguun has been running a retail mobile phone business with her husband since 2009. She purchases the products wholesale from the suppliers. Now she plans to purchase the phones from Korea as they produce qualified phones with high specifications. She is trying hard to improve their livelihood with her husband. 

Dulguun is an ambitious young woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the products in large quantities from Korea. I have a further plan to develop the business." The total amount she is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy more Korean mobile phones.

loans.use: To buy more Korean mobile phones.

loans.name: Tsevelravjaa

texts.en:
Tsevelravjaa is a 49-year-old widowed woman who lives with her daughter in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. Her daughter studies at the college. She has been running a retail meat business since 2002. She trades beef, mutton, and different types of meat from her well-positioned shop counter. She purchases the meat wholesale. There are many regular customers who appreciate her business products. 

She is a diligent woman who is trying alone to improve her livelihood and pay for her daughter's college tuition fees. She says, "I would like to purchase the meat wholesale to raise the income and save more. I need support for my business activity." The total amount she is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to buy more meat wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more meat wholesale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: The fishing and food-vending business that Susana previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life. This time, for her seventh loan, she is requesting Php 15,000 to buy tools and equipment to repair her fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 42 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school.

Janet is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant business.

Evangeline has been in this business for twenty years. She earns more income from meat vending.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila es una mujer de 44 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos a cargo. Vive en casa propia en la zona urbana del distrito de La Matanza, es una persona bastante respetada y cuenta con solvencia moral muy alta.
La actividad a la que se dedica Petronila es a la crianza y venta de animales pequeños y aves de corral, negocio que tiene en su domicilio hace 4 años. 
El préstamo de 2010 nuevos soles lo solicita para invertirlo en la compra de una refrigeradora, compra de mesas, compra de maíz duro, para el proceso de la chicha de jora, y para que de es manera tenga mejores ingresos y en consecuencia una mejor condición de vida en la zona, además los clientes queden satisfechos con la buena atención que Petronila les brinde.
texts.en:
44-year old Petronila is married and has two children to support. She lives in her own home in the urban area of La Matanza district. She is very well-respected and is a highly moral, responsible person.

Petronila raises and then sells small animals and poultry from her home, a job she has had for four years. The 2010 soles she is seeking will be used to buy a refrigerator, tables, and maize so she can make chicha de jora (a traditional corn liquor) and thus earn more money. This would enable her to improve her standard of living. Her customers will also be pleased with the good service that Petronila provides.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Luz De Fátima

texts.es:
La señora Luz de Fátima es una Sauceña que se dedica al pequeño comercio donde su negocio consiste en la venta de comida variada y refrescos el cual tiene varios años de tenerlo y el que le ha permitido obtener sus propios ingresos para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, también en la construcción de su propia vivienda.
Inició con capital propio el cual fue un regalo de su esposo para que se dedicara a desarrollar un negocio el que ha ido creciendo poco a poco por la buena a tención a sus clientes y la exquisita comida que vende a diario a todos los visitantes o habitantes del poblado.
En la actualidad necesita de capital para ampliar el local y adquirir los insumos necesarios al por mayor para la elaboración de la comida y refrescos es por tal motivo que decidió solicitar su primer crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de llevar a cabo su plan y adquirir mesas y sillas plásticas, plátanos, frutas, azúcar, arroz, jugos y pollo, para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes y que estos queden satisfechos.
texts.en:
Señora Luz de Fátima is from El Sauce, and she makes a living through a small business where she sells a variety of food and soft drinks.  She has done this for several years, and it has let her earn her own income to help her husband with their home's expenses.  They are also building their own home.

She started her business with her own capital, which was a gift from her husband so she could dedicate herself to developing a business.  It has grown little by little due to her good customer service and the exquisite food that she sells daily to all of the visitors and residents of the town.

Currently, she needs capital to expand her location and to acquire the necessary supplies wholesale to make her food and drinks.  This is why she decided to request her first loan from Ceprodel with the objective of carrying out her plan and acquiring plastic tables and chairs, plantains, fruit, sugar, rice, juice, and chicken, to offer her customers better service so they stay satisified.

loans.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs, plantains, fruit, sugar, rice, juice, and chicken.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a 43-year-old carpenter who has four children with his partner. His eldest child is 20 years old and the youngest just one month old. Manuel has been producing furniture for about five years. He is requesting a loan to buy materials such as wood, paint, and nails. Right now, his business is quite small; he produces four pieces per week. He hopes that continued investment will allow him to increase the pace of production and expand his clientele.

Manuel is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Vallecito" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, and nails

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es una mujer de 54 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos a cargo. Vive en casa propia con sus hijos ubicada en el caserío Totoral Alto, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la zona rural, pero cuenta con servicio de luz eléctrica.
Graciela se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino y porcino, los cuales producen carne o leche, que son comercializados en el mercado local. Adicionalmente, cuenta con 1 hectárea de terreno cultivado que trabajan sus hijos.
El monto del crédito asciende a 1300 nuevos soles, que serán utilizados para la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado y para comprar fertilizantes que puedan ayudar a sus cultivos a crecer fuertes para su posterior comercialización.
texts.en:
Graciela is a 54-year-old woman.  She is a widow and cares for her three children.  She lives in her own home with her children in the town of Totoral Alto in the district of Tambogrande.  She lives in the rural area, but she has electricity.

Graciela raises cows, cheep, and pigs for a living.  They produce either meat or milk, which are sold at the local market.  She also has 1ha of farmland that her children work on.

The sum of her loan is 1,300 nuevos soles, which will be used to buy animal feed for her livestock and to buy fertilizers that will help her crops grow strong to be sold later.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is 30 years old. She is married and has one child, age 6.  In 2001, she established her cow milk selling business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow.  In the future, Shanti plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is 42 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and has four children. Marlon owns and operates a motorcycle business to earn a living. He has been doing this for 7 years. Each month, he earns about PHP 2,000. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to repair the motorcycle and provide better service to passengers. Marlon joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2010. In the future, Marlon hopes to pursue business operations sooner and improve his service offerings.

loans.use: to repair the motorcycle and provide better service to passengers.

loans.name: Rama Shahi

texts.en:
Rama Shahi is 46 years old. She is married and has two children, age 23 and 21.  In 2000, she established her poultry business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 7 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy small chickens for her business.  In the future, Rama Shahi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 


In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens.

loans.name: Meera

texts.en:
Meera is 33 years old. She is married and has two children, age 16 and 14.  In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Meera plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith, tiene 43 años de edad, vive en Tela Atlántida junto a su hija de 13 años de edad, su conyugue y su madre.
Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, hace dos años comenzó su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de comida, jugos y refrescos. Vende almuerzos, cenas, desayunos, comidas rápidas, atendiendo a sus clientes todo el día. Este negocio lo ha mantenido en crecimiento por su buena administración y por reinversión de utilidades, lo que ha permitido tener más clientes y ser reconocido.
Actualmente necesita un mejor equipo de cocina para mejorar el proceso de elaboración de comida y brindar un mejor servicio, para lo cual solicita un préstamo de 25,000.00 Lempiras para comprar una estufa de gas, un mantenedor de comida y un asador de carne.  
Su sueño es llegar a ser dueña de un restaurante y darle una buena educación a su hija y mejorar su condición de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Judith, age 43, lives in Tela Atlántida with her 13 year old daughter, her husband, and her mother.

She is an enterprising woman who started her own business two years ago.  She makes and sells food, juices, and soft drinks.  She sells breakfasts, lunches, dinners, and fast food.  She tends to her customers all day.  She has kept this business growing through her good administration and by reinvesting her profits.  This has allowed her to have more cutomers and to be well-known.

She now needs better kitchen equipment in order to improve the process of making the food and offering better service.  In order to do so she is requesting a loan for 25,000 lempiras to buy a gas stove, a food warmer, and a grill.

Her dreams are to come to own a restaurant, to give her daughter a good education, and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy kitchen equipment like a gas stove, a food warmer, and a grill.

loans.name: Fatima Lisseth

texts.es: Fátima Lisseth es una emprendedora que toda la vida ha trabajado para salir adelante y apoyar en los gastos del hogar, esta emprendedora ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León en  crédito lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con muchos deseos de superación en la vida y en negocio. Actualmente esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos lo cual comprara ropa, sandalias, zapatos, camisas, blusas, blúmer entre otros productos.
texts.en: Fátima Lisseth is a hard worker who all her life has worked to get ahead and help with the household expenses.  This entrepreneur has already worked with Fundación León on one loan, at which time she showed herself to be a responsible person and with a great desire to overcome all obstacles in life and at her work.  Currently, she is asking for financing to buy more products and will buy clothing, sandals, shoes, shirts, blouses, and underwear as well as other items.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sandals, shoes, shirts, blouses, and underwear as well as other items.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 24 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia en el Anexo Tinajones en Huaca de Barro, en el distrito de Mórrope. Es una persona con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
La actividad que realiza Gladys es la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio y que, una vez alcanzado su peso y talla ideal, quincenalmente negocia en los mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque. Ella alimenta a sus animales con polvillo, purina y pastos naturales. El esposo de Gladys se dedica a la pesca, y así contribuye al crecimiento  económico del hogar.
El monto del crédito asciende a 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de alimento para sus animales.
texts.en:
Gladys is 24 years old, married and has three dependent children. She lives in her own house is Anexo Tinajones in Huaca de Barro, in the district of Mórrope. She is a person who has good personal and employment references.

Gladys breeds and sells animals, breeding them behind her home and when they reach their ideal weight, she takes them every two weeks to the markets in Chiclayo and Lambayeque. She feeds her animals rice, purine, and natural grass. Her husband is a fisherman and thus he contributes to the financial standing of the home.

The loan amount of 1000 soles will be used to invest in the purchase of feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her livestock

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is thirty-four years old and is a married man with two children aged two and six years. He has had a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business for five years. He earns 2,500 PHP per month with this business. He also tills a small parcel of land where he grows rice crops.

Roger has requested a loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and farm fertilizers. He hopes to be a good provider to his family.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en: Forty-seven-year-old Rufa is a married woman with nine children aged between five and twenty-three. She has been engaged in farming for eighteen years. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Rufa earns 2,000 PHP per month from farming, which she says is not enough to feed her big family. She works hard to improve her earnings and sustain her family. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. Rufa hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ba

texts.en:
Ba is a fifty-eight-year-old married woman with four children, two sons and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband run a general store and sell beverages and coffee to people in their community. She started this business six years ago.
  
Ba would like a loan to buy new products such as a large variety of cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell in her store to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes that she will be able to increase her income and set aside some savings through the loan.

loans.use: To buy new products such as a variety of cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is 65 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin. Socorro is widowed with six children.
 
Socorro has a basket business and earns approximately 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Socorro has requested a loan to purchase additional materials for basket making. 

Socorro has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Socorro hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rattan for weaving baskets.

loans.name: Ba

texts.en:
Ba, sixty-five, is married and has two children: one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired and helps her to run a cafe in front of their house. 

Ba started this business six years ago. She sells many kind of soft drinks and coffee to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more furniture, foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more furniture, foods and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Junalie

texts.en:
Junalie is 50 years old, married and a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Junalie has been in this business for 15 years.

Junalie requested a PHP 29500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business. In the future, Junalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients

loans.name: Khadim Rassoul

texts.fr: Khadim est un jeune célibataire, sans enfant. Il tient une boutique de vente de produits cosmétiques et d'articles divers.Il entretient avec les revenus tirés de ce commerce sa famille notamment ses deux parents et ses petits frères dont il s'occupe de la scolarité.Il prend en charge également ses propres besoins. Face à l'augmentation de sa clientèle, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour renforcer son fonde  de commerce en achetant notamment des caisses de lait de beauté, de mèches, de parfums et d'autres produits divers. Son ambition est d'ouvrir un second magasin.
texts.en:
Khadim is a young single man without children. He manages a retail store for cosmetics and various other articles. With the profits from this business, he supports his family, notably his two parents and his younger brothers, whose schooling fees he pays. He also takes care of himself.
Faced with the growth of his clientele, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 XOF to increase his working capital and purchase boxes of beauty moisturizers, hair extensions, perfumes and a variety of other products. He ambitions to open a second store.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products, including boxes of beauty moisturizers, hair extensions, perfumes and other.

loans.name: Iris Consuelo

texts.es:
Iris, de 45 años de edad, casada, vive en una aldea del municipio de Arizona, Tela Atlántida, junto a sus 5 hijos y su familia.

Doña Iris,  tiene aproximadamente 10 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de productos lácteos como ser: queso, cremas, cuajada y otros. Esta actividad que realiza todos los días, le ayuda a generar otros ingresos para aportar al hogar. 
Ha mantenido este negocio por medio de financiamientos, ha obtenido varios préstamos con ODEF, actualmente está solicitando 18,000.00 Lempiras para comprar la materia prima o insumos como ser: Leche, cuajo, sal y otros para la elaboración de quesos y otros productos lácteos.
Su meta es mantener activo este negocio como su fuente de ingresos que le permita poder tener una vida de mejor calidad en su familia.
texts.en:
Iris is 45 years old, married, and lives in a neighborhood in the town of Arizona, Tela Atlántida, with her five children and the rest of her family.

For approximately 10 years, Doña Iris has been producing dairy products such as cheese, cream, curds, and other items. She operates her business every day since it helps to generate additional income to support her household. Iris has maintained this business through the use of several loans she has obtained from ODEF. She is currently requesting 18,000 HNL in order to buy raw materials and supplies such as milk, rennet, salt, and other items used in making cheese and other dairy products. Her goal is to maintain an active business, since this is a source of income by which she is able to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making dairy products such as milk, rennet, salt, and other items.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 27 years old and has two children with his partner. His oldest child is five years old. He has been running an independent carpentry workshop for three years, though he has 10 years of woodworking experience in total. He employs two craftsmen who help him produce all types of furniture for individual clients. Edwin is requesting a loan in order to buy materials such as wood and paint. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to sell to institutional clients as well.

Edwin is receiving an individual loan as a long-time member of the village bank "Vallecito" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy wood and paint

loans.name: Stefany

texts.en:
Stefany is 20 years old and has two jobs. In the morning and afternoon, she offers a service driving children to and from school. In her free time, she works as an assistant preparing desserts such as carrot cake and flan in her house. She does not sell her sweets in a formal shop. Rather, Stefany takes her products to local businesses and schools to find customers. A loan will help Stefany buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, and milk. Her dream is to open a cake shop in the future.

Stefany is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Vallecito" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients like flour, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia is 38 years old and lives with her partner and three children. One of her children just finished secondary school. The other two are in primary and secondary school, respectively. Lidia has been running a carpentry business for about five years. The studio produces items such as beds, shelves, doors, and windows, which Lidia then sells at a local market.
