A loan will help Lidia purchase wood to produce more furniture. Lidia dreams of enlarging her business and moving from a rented space to a workshop of her own.

Lidia is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Vallecito" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan has worked as a taxi driver in Cusco for 12 years. He is now looking to invest in another business. A loan will help him open a small grocery store in a rented space, primarily by allowing him to buy merchandise. Juan is 36 years old and has two children with his partner. He says that it is important for him to provide for his children’s education, and he dreams of expanding the store into a mini-market.

Juan is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Vallecito" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy grocery merchandise such as sugar, milk, and pasta

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr: Kodjovi , jeune homme de 34ans est marié à une coiffeuse et  a 02 enfants tous à l’école. L’ainé a 09ans et le dernier 05ans. Il est chaudronnier de profession et exerce son activité avec 04 employés à la maison (Activité qu’il a démarrée en 2005). Il sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter une machine de chaudronnerie : Post à soudure. Il veut renforcer son activité en l’agrandissant. Il souhaiterait assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kodjovi , a young man of 34, is married to a hairdresser. They have two children, who both attend school. The older is nine years old and the younger five years old.
Kodjovi is a metal worker by trade; he manages a home business with four employees. He started this business in 2005. He is requesting this first loan from WAGES to purchase a machine for working metal, namely welding equipment.
He wants to strengthen his business by growing it. His wish is to ensure that his children attend school.

loans.use: to buy a metal work machine (welding equipment)

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is a forty-two-year-old married woman with four children, three daughters and one son. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a worker for a factory in the local community.

For over ten years Thao has been operating a general store selling basic household necessities and many kinds of instant food in her community. She would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods in bulk to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover in her business.

Thao hopes that through her loan she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and set aside savings for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of goods in bulk to stock her general store.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is a forty-seven-year-old married woman. She lives with her two sons and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in the construction field. For nine years, she has run a shop selling clothes to people in her community.

Chi would like a loan to purchase better quality clothes  at competitive prices from wholesalers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase better quality clothes at competitive prices from wholesalers.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 45 years old and lives in Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City. She is married with three school-age children.

Lenie has a general store business and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Lenie has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Lenie hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comite se formo con las integrantes de otro grupo, que decidieron formar uno en sus barrios y de esa forma poder ayudarse las unas a las otras. El deseo de ellas es ir ayudándose y ayudar  a sus familias. 
La Sra Justa integrante del comité  es comerciante tiene 54 años, es soltera, tiene 4 hijas.  Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, con la cual abastece a sus vecinos del barrio y de otras zonas. Su meta es ir agrandando su negocio y darle mejor comodidad a sus clientes. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de panificados, lácteos, frutas, verduras etc. Con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group of borrowers was formed with members of another group, which decided to form one in their neighborhood, and in this way they could help one another. Their desire is to help themselves and their families.

Justa, a member of the group, is 54 years old, single, and has 4 daughters. She has a well supplied store, which supplies the residents of her neighborhood and other areas. Her goal is to expand her business and to make it more comfortable for her customers.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy baked goods, dairy, fruits, vegetables and other items with which she can stock up and fulfill the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, dairy, fruit, vegetables and other items

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se llama 8 de Diciembre, es de la ciudad de Concepción y está integrado por 18 mujeres, quienes son todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias y darles lo que ellas no pudieron tener. 
Una de las miembros es la señora, Rosalia, quien nos comenta que se dedica a las ventas de todo tipo. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, con todo tipo de productos. Es gracias a su arduo trabajo y a la buena atención a sus clientes que le está yendo muy bien. 
Ella solicita el crédito ya que quiere abastecerse con leche, gaseosas, fideos, y demás insumos que son los que más vende y lo que más salida tienen. Agradece a la fundación
texts.en: This committee is called December 8th. It is located in the city of Concepción and is made up of 18 women, who are all friends and neighbours. The women are very close. They support each other constantly and above all the inspire each other to keep fighting to give their families what they were unable to have. One member is Rosalia, who tells us that she makes a living selling all kinds of things. She has a grocery store which is well stocked with a variety of products. Thanks to her hard work and good customer service, this business is going very well for her. She is asking for this loan to stock up on milk, soft drinks, pasta and other popular items. She is very grateful to the foundation.

loans.use: To buy milk, soft drinks, pasta and other items.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda runs a small grocery store in a rented locale. She has had this business for 12 years and is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise. She says that the products that sell most quickly are soft drinks, sugar, rice, and oil. In addition, she offers vegetables, chicken, and beef. Yolanda is 38 years old and living with her partner and four children. Her dreams are to have her own house and to expand her store into an emporium.

Yolanda is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Vallecito" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy grocery merchandise such as soft drinks, sugar, rice, and oil

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona works hard to support her family. Melona is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Melona has been in this business for 3 years now.

Melona requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance. In the future, Melona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for maintenance

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 43 years old and married with two children. She and her 20-year-old daughter run a school transportation service, taking children to and from school in a van. In addition, they bake cakes and other sweets such as carrot cake and flan from their home, which they then sell at local businesses and schools. A loan will help Guadalupe improve her transport service, for example cleaning seats and making vehicle repairs, and buy baking ingredients. Guadalupe dreams of having her own house and buying a car for personal use.

Guadalupe is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Vallecito" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to repair her van and buy ingredients for her baking business

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 61 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Nena runs a rice retail business in the Philippines. She has been running the rice retail business for 5 years and also earns an income from trucking services.

Nena requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. Nena has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Kheo

texts.en:
Kheo, 50, is a responsible mother of 4 children, living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She generates a living by cultivating rice on her existing farmland. She owns around two hectares of farmland, growing rice in both the rainy season and dry season of the year.

In the previous years, Kheo encountered difficulties in operating her farm work, especially in the dry season, due to the lack of a water pump to provide enough water to her crops. And this year, Kheo wants to solve the problems she has experienced and make improvement to her business. So she decided to take out a loan to purchase a piping system to pump water from the water storage unit to supply enough water to her dry-season rice. She said that she won’t expend a lot like last time. Also, she can provide this service to local villagers in exchange for money. In the future, Kheo hopes that she is able to provide a further education to her children because she wants them to earn university degrees and have good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase a piping system to irrigate her dry-season rice.

loans.name: May

texts.en: May would like to take a further loan to buy a larger quantity and variety of noodles to sell from her stall. May's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in further increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of noodles to stock her store.

loans.name: Am

texts.en: Am is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products, such as eggs, milk, beverages and confectionery in bulk, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy basic goods such as food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Jesutogbe 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUTOGBE 2 est formé de neuf personnes qui résident toutes dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Suzanne, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la septième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Suzanne est une veuve ayant à sa charge trois enfants, qui sont ses enfants et qui sont tous scolarisés. Suzanne vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Suzanne n'a pas été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Suzanne vend de l'akassa (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) et des beignets fabriqué à base de farine de blé de façon secondaire. Suzanne s'approvisionne dans un marché du marché. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Suzanne désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Suzanne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUTOGBE 2, un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Group Jesutogbe 2 is formed of nine persons, who all reside in the same district. The group’s leader, named Suzanne, is raising her hand on the photo. It is the seventh time that this group is requesting help from ALIDé in order to increase their business.

Suzanne is a window with three children in her care; they are her own children and all attend school. Suzanne leaves alone with her children, and provides for their various needs by herself. Suzanne did not go to school. To provide for her needs, Suzanne sells akassa (a local food specialty made based on corn starch), and secondarily fried dough made from wheat flour. Suzanne gets her supplies from a stall at the market. Looking to increase customer satisfaction and revenue, Suzanne wants have a larger stock of products. To this end, Suzanne is requesting a seventh loan from ALIDé together with the other members of group Jesutogbe 2. Previous loans were punctually repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn, wheat flour, and peanut oil.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Maria Auxiliadora”  trabaja con la fundación desde el año 2010, está integrado por 12 mujeres quienes son todas amigas y vecinas de ese barrio, que se unieron con las ganas de salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia. 
Casilda es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de leche y también de queso. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y cuenta que todos los días ella empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, ya que empieza a repartir la leche que vende. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y ser una gran proveedora de leche. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche y queso, con lo cual podrá cumplir la demanda de sus clientes. Casilda, y su grupo agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” women’s committee has been working with the Fundación since 2010; it has 12 members who are all friends and neighbors from that neighborhood who joined together wanting to get ahead and help their families this way.

Casilda is one of the group members.  She sells milk and also cheese.  She is a very hardworking, enterprising woman and relates that she starts her work day very early in the morning when she starts to deliver the milk she sells.  Her dream is to be able to continue growing and become a great milk supplier.

She’s asking for the loan to buy milk and cheese to meet customer demand.  Casilda and her group thank the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity they are getting.

loans.use: to buy milk and cheese to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Munhjargal

texts.en:
Munhjargal is a 38-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children in a suburban area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband operates a taxi service business. The daughters study at secondary school and a college. She started a knitting business 7 years ago based on her talent. The demand is great because her offering price is lower than the market prices. She sells what she knits at the trade center Narantuul.

 Munhjargal is a talented woman who says, "I would like to develop the business activity by purchasing some woolen yarn and other materials. I am planning to open  my own store for knitting products." The total amount she is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to purchase knitting yarn.

loans.use: To purchase knitting yarn

loans.name: Lhagvadulam

texts.en:
Lhagvadulam is a 36-year-old woman who lives with her husband and a son in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She makes beautiful traditional clothes and sells them at the biggest market center of the city. So far, she has been running the business at home. But as it grows bigger, she is planning to build a workplace and employ workers. 

Lhagvadulam is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to develop the business activity by purchasing a new sewing machine and renting a workplace." The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, 42, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a married to Noel, a driver, and is the mother of four children. Together with her husband she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Elena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elena dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is from Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Vilma is married and has one child. To make a living, Vilma plants & harvests corn. Vilma has been engaged in her business for 8 years and earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vilma joined GDMPC. Vilma is requesting a loan of 4,730 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Saranchimeg

texts.en:
Saranchimeg is a 44-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 3 children in Darhan city, Mongolia. Her husband is employed. The oldest child studies at college and the daughters study at secondary school. She started underwear retailing at the international trade center in 2009. She is a responsible woman and a caring mother for the family at the same time, improving their livelihood. The business activity has been successful and she has made many regular customers. 

Saranchimeg is an ambitious woman who says, "I would like to develop the business activity by purchasing the underwear supplies wholesale. I have a dream of opening my own store." The total amount she is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy more underwear supplies.

loans.use: To buy more underwear supplies wholesale

loans.name: Baby Ruth

texts.en:
This is Baby Ruth, 41, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Epifanio, a overseas contract worker, and is the mother of four children. Two children are in college while one each is still in high school and elementary school. Together with her husband and children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Baby Ruth operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus, there is a need for computers, especially among students who need to do research and papers. Baby Ruth rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Baby Ruth hopes to acquire a bigger place for her shop and dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 49 years old. Crisanta is married and has two children. To make a living, Crisanta owns & operates a business making & selling "banana cue" (fried bananas on a stick). Crisanta has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

 In 2007, Crisanta joined GDMPC. Crisanta is requesting a loan of 10,487 PHP which will be used to buy more banana to cook and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to cook and sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, 36 years old, is married and has a one-year-old son. For the last three years, she  has been running a retail store where sells trousers, shirts, children's wear and school uniforms in a busy commercial area. In addition to the clothes retail store, she runs a retail store where she sells household necessities to add to her income.  

Catherine is facing a business environment of insufficient funds for improving the business. This is her first loan and she is planning to use the loan proceeds of Kes 20,000, hoping to improve her business, by  restocking with school uniforms and children's wear.  She has a dream and goal of running a boutique in the nearby town. Catherine is a quiet and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms and children's wear.

loans.name: Liberacion Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Liberación esta integrado por seis personas humildes de un pueblo muy pequeño llamado  San francisco el Maguey que se significa miseria en el desierto antes de llegar ala comunidad hay un arrollo llamado tuzapa , en san francisco el maguey hay muchos árboles verdes  aproximadamente hay como  doscientos hogares.
Una de las tradiciones de san Francisco Maguey es el baile de la vaqueros  esto se celebra el día de muertos salen los  hombres, mayores y menores de edad a bailar en las calles de la comunidad  se visten de traje rojo un gorro y un bastón, la música que bailan es de viento, los ciudadanos de la comunidad los acompañan  aplaudiéndole cada baile.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Gelacia una señora platicadora  legre y muy divertida.
Doña Gelacia se dedica a la venta de  tortillas desde hace  ocho años, nos cuenta que tiene una tortilla que se llama  La Nina, en la tortillería tiene dos trabajadores, quienes se dedican a prender las maquinas y lavar el nixtamal.
Doña Gelacia también le ayuda a sus empleados ya que también  ella pesa las tortillas y la vende en la tortillería mientras sus trabajadores van a las colonias de su comunidad  en una motocicleta a vender las otras tortillas.
Nos dice que esta muy contenta con su trabajo ya que le deja buenas ganancias y así puede hacer crecer más su negocio y generar empleos.
Lo que no le gusta de su negocio es que la tortillería se calienta mucho y a se mucho calor y  se deshidrata  mucho ella y sus trabajos.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Pedro de  sesenta y seis años de edad con quien tiene siete hijos quienes ya están casados.
Doña Gelacia nos dice que va utilizar el crédito para la compra de más maíz, cal, papel para envolver tortillas y también a reparar una maquina para la elaborar las tortillas.
Esta muy agradecida con fundacion por ayudar a la gente trabajadora con deseos de mejorar su vida y su  comunidad.
Las otras integrantes son: 
Juana- se dedica a la venta de carnes frías.
Maria. Se dedica a la venta de carnes frías.
Criselda- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Efrén- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Hipólita Cytlaly – quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Le dan las gracias a  fundacion  por ayudar a todas las personas que  desean  ver un mejor futuro un mejor México y unos mejores niños.
texts.en:
The Liberación Group is comprised of six humble people from San Francisco el Maguey, a very small town that is becoming known as “misery in the desert”.  Before reaching the community, there is an arroyo (stream bed) called Tuzapa.  In San Franciso de Maguey, there are approximately two hundred homes amid the many green trees.  One of San Franciso de Maguey’s traditions is the cowboy dance, celebrated on the Day of the Dead.   Men, both young and old, come out to dance in the streets of the community dressed in red suits and hats, and carrying canes. They dance to the music of wind instruments as the citizens accompany them, applauding each dance.  

One of the members of the Liberación Group is Gelacia, a cheerful, talkative, and fun lady.  Gelacia has been selling tortillas for eight years.  She tells us that she has a tortilla called La Nina.  She has two workers in the tortillería (tortilla shop) who operate the machines and wash the nixtamal (cooked maize).  Gelacia also helps her employees by weighing the tortillas and selling them at the tortillería while they go to the community suburbs by motor cycle to sell more tortillas.  She tells us that she is very happy with her work because it provides her with good profits that enable her to grow her business more and generate work.  What she dislikes about her business is that the tortillería gets overheated and it’s very hot.  As a result, she and her employees become very dehydrated.  

She is happily married to Pedro who is sixty-six years old.  They have seven children who are already married.  Gelicia tells us that she will use the loan to purchase more corn, lime, and tortilla wrapping paper and also to repair the tortilla machine.  She is very grateful to the foundation for helping working people who desire to improve their lives and their community.

A list of the other members follows:
Juana, who sells cold meats
Maria, who sells cold meats
Criselda, who sells meals
Efrén, who sells groceries
Hipólita Cytlaly, who sells clothing

They thank the foundation for helping all the people who wish to see a better future and a better Mexico for their children.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making tortillas.

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es: Bonifacia Aliaga es integrante de la alcancía comunal Caminando al Éxito con formado por siete socias,  todas ellas vecinas ya que viven en el mismo barrio, ellas radican en el distrito del Agustino. Un grupo de mujeres optimistas para los negocios y muy empeñosas en salir adelante.  Muestra de ello es la señora Bonifacia de 44 años de edad es madre soltera de un pequeño niño que es su adoración y su motivo principal por salir adelante. Ella desde muy temprano se dedica a la fabricación de billuteria que es la realización de artículos artesanales como pulseras y collares  entre otras cosas, este trabajo le ha generado ingresos modestos y gracias a esto ha podido salir adelante junto a su hijo y comenzó en este negocio, en sus ratos libres se dedica al cuidado a personas de tercera edad.  En el futuro le gustaría  poder tener un bazar. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de artículos que utiliza para la fabricación de pulseras.
texts.en: Bonifacia Aliaga is a member of the Caminando al Éxito [Walking to Success] communal bank, made up of seven members. All of them are neighbors and live in the same neighborhood, the El Agustino District. The are a group of optimist businesswomen who are very dedicated to getting ahead. Bonifacia is an example of that. She is 44 years old and a single mother of a young son whom she adores and who is her main reason for getting ahead. She works making jewelry starting very early in the morning. She makes artisanal items such as bracelets and necklaces, among other things. This job has brought her modest income and thanks to it she has been able to get ahead with her son. In her free time she takes care of elderly people. In the future she would like to have a store. With the latest loan, she will invest in buying items she will need to make bracelets.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials to make jewelry.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng is 45 years old and is a married woman with 10 children. Presently, five of her children are already married and live separately around Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. 

Leng has been dedicated to rice farming as a source of income for more than 25 years. Leng has gained good experiences from this period of time. She knows how to take care of her rice crops, balance the water in fields and use the right fertilizers to insure a fruitful harvest. She works in this business with her spouse and also has some of their children help to maintain the business.

To improve her farming business, Leng would like to borrow some funds from HKL to purchase an additional plot of farmland. Through this loan, Leng hopes to increase her rice output in the coming seasons and to provide good living conditions for her family. In the future, she wants to save money to renovate her present house and to build a strong ladder.

loans.use: to purchase an additional plot of farmland.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es originario de Estelí, de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de tabaco, de 33 años de edad, padre de 1 hijo el cual esta a su cargo. Inicio su actividad desde hace 6 años, el ya ha trabajado con créditos otorgado por nuestra institución  anteriormente obtuvo un préstamo que utilizo para la compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra para la siembra de tabaco, el cual le ayudo ya que ahora cuenta con mas capital de trabajo que antes al igual logro hacerle mejoras a su vivienda. Actualmente solicita el crédito para pago de mano de obra, mantenimiento de manzana y media de tabaco ahora en la etapa de corte y secado.
Mediante este financiamiento podrá cubrir las necesidades de mantenimiento del cultivo obteniendo mejor calidad en su producto para poder venderlo  a mejor precio y tener más ingresos, sus planes futuros es ampliar aun más el área de siembra de tabaco con el objetivo de obtener mas capital de trabajo hasta no depender de los créditos y brindar mas empleos a las personas que habitan en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Juan is from Estelí. He is a farmer and he plants tobacco. He is 33 years old and the father of one son, who is dependent on him. He started this activity 6 years ago. He has worked with previous loans from our institution. Previously he took out a loan he used to buy materials and pay for labor costs to plant his tobacco. This helped him because he has more working capital now than he did before and was able to make some improvements on his home.Now he is asking for the loan to pay for labor costs and do maintenance on his tobacco crop now during cutting and drying time.

With this loan, he will be able to pay for what he needs to maintain his crop, obtaining a better quality product to sell at a better price and have more income. His plans for the future are to enlarge his tabacco crop even more in order to obtain more working capital till he won't have to depend on the loans and be able to offer jobs to people who live in his community.

loans.use: to pay for labor and land maintenance for his tobacco crop now during cutting and drying time.

loans.name: Cesi

texts.es:
La Sra. Cesi tiene 47 años y tiene 2 hijos que aun van a la escuela. Ella tiene una despensa y venta de ropas usadas en su casa propia. Comenta que anteriormente trabajaba en casa de familia y cuando tuvo a su hijo empezó a vender bebidas ya que en su casa tenía una cancha de voley y así de a poco empezó a traer cosas para vender en su kiosko.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo y su esfuerzo. Su meta es seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia. 
Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar bebidas y también  fardos de ropas usadas que trae del Brasil, y agradece a la Fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Cesi is 47 years old and has 2 children who are still going to school. She has a store selling used clothing in her own home. She says that she used to work at home and when she had her son she began to sell drinks as at her house she had a volleyball court and so little by little she began to bring things to sell in her kiosk.

She is a hard working person and eager to get ahead and to help her family through her work and her efforts. Her goal is to continue growing and helping her family.

With the money from the loan she will buy drinks and also bundles of used clothing that comes from Brazil. She gives thanks to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy drinks and bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La Sra. Virginia tiene 33 años y es casada con cuatro hijos que son de las edades de catorce, once, nueve y tres, ella se dedica a la actividad de llantera, ella infla llantas de movilidades, realiza parches de llantas, todo lo que se refiere al arreglo de llantas de movilidades, su taller  que se encuentran en la zona de villa Copacabana,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Virginia utilizara  este préstamo para la construcción de un muro de contención en su casa, la Sra. Virginia  enfrenta retos en su negocio el mal humor de algunos choferes, ya que le tratan mal pero esto no le impide seguir adelante porque a pesar de las dificultades ya que ella no tiene  competencia y por tal motivo tiene mucha clientela,  utilizara los beneficios en seguir mejorando su domicilio ya que ella ahora con la construcción de su muro de contención se siente mas tranquila, la Sra. Virginia se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Virginia is 33 years old and married with four children, ages 14, 11, 9 and 3. She works in tire repair; she inflates vehicle tires, patches tires - everything that has to do with fixing vehicle tires. Her shop is located in the area of the village Copacabana. 

This loan will be Virginia's first with the institution. She will use it for the construction of a load-bearing wall in her home. 

Virginia faces challenges in her business, such as the bad moods of some drivers who treat her poorly, but this doesn't stop her from getting ahead. In spite of the difficulties, she doesn't have any competition and for that reason has a large customer base. She will use these advantages to continue improving her home; already with the construction of this load-bearing wall she feels much better. Virginia is very happy and appreciative to the institution for the help offered.

loans.use: to build a load-bearing wall in her home.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela has a bookstore where she sells books and stationery. A loan will help her purchase more books from wholesalers in downtown Cusco. She is 35 years old and has three children with her partner. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to buy a car. Graciela says that she enjoys attending her village bank’s monthly meetings at Asociación Arariwa. She thinks that the loans are important because the financial support allows her and her fellow group members to continue working.

Graciela is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Vallecito" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy books

loans.name: Clavel Group

texts.es: Ligian, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Clavel, tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y progenitora de 2 hijos, su esposo es agricultor y ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan. Ligian aprendió a elaborar pan desde que era una niña porque tenía que ayudar a su madre ya que ésta se dedicaba a esa actividad. Con el transcurso del tiempo Ligian fue creciendo y se casó, y para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar decidió dedicarse a la venta de pan. Ella trabaja en conjunto con una amiga, la elaboración de pan lo hace dos veces por semana, se levanta a las 5:00 am hasta las 2:00 pm, y lo  vende de forma ambulante, además Ligian trabaja por contrato ya que su producto es muy solicitado por los clientes. Ligian reside en una comunidad no muy cercana y su mayor dificultad es transportarse hasta el centro del municipio para adquirir los insumos necesarios para poder elaborar el pan. El préstamo que Ligian solicita lo necesita para la compra de huevos, harina, levadura, bandejas y azúcar. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá ofrecerles a sus clientes mayor cantidad y variedad de panes. Su meta es llegar a tener una panadería y así poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ligian tiene seis ciclos de trabajar con FAMA y han cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Ligian, a member of the Clavel communal bank, is 25 years old, she is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer and her business is making and selling bread. 

At a young age, Ligian learned to make bread as she had to help her mother who was working in this field. As time passed, Ligian grew older, she married and, to help her husband with the household expenses, she decided to work selling bread. She works with her friend, making bread twice a week, she wakes up at 5:00am working until 2:00pm which she sells from house to house. Additionally, Ligian works for contracts as her product is highly sought after by customers. 

Ligian lives in a community that is not very close by, and her main difficulty is getting to the municipality to acquire the ingredients needed to be able to make bread. The loan which Ligian requests needs it to buy egg, flour, yeast, oven trays and sugar. With the support of this loan, she will be able to offer her customers a larger quantity and variety of breads. Her aim is to have a bakery and in that way provide her children a better quality of life. Ligian has been through six loan cycles with FAMA, and they have made their monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sugar, flour and oven trays.

loans.name: Daniela Samantha

texts.es:
La socia Daniela continua dedicandose a la venta de ropa como casacas,pantalones,blusas,polos entre otros,ella vende a sus clientes que le solicitan como a sus amistades y familiares,la socia es una persona empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar adelante,la socia vende su mercaderia en una tienda que ella alquilo ,la socia espera poder agrandar su negocio para de esta manera brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

La socia Daniela requiere el préstamo para comprar mas mercaderia para su negocio como casacas.

La socia Daniela esta feliz por el credito y se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Daniela continues working in the sales of clothing such as jackets, pants, blouses, polos and other items. She sells to her customers when they request it, including friends and relatives. She is a diligent person and eager to get ahead. The borrower sells her merchandise in a store that she rents. She is hoping to be able to expand her business in order to give her family a better quality of life.

The borrower Daniela is requesting the loan in order to buy more merchandise for her business such as jackets.

Daniela is happy to receive a loan and she promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business such as jackets

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en:
Luis Alberto has been working as a taxi driver in Cusco for 10 years. He is 37 years old and has two children with his partner. He currently owns two vehicles, one of which he rents out to another driver. A loan will help Luis Alberto replace one of his cars with a new one. Luis Alberto dreams of owning more cars so that he can employ more drivers and thus run a large transport business.

Luis Alberto is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Vallecito" in Cusco, which is located close to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu in the Andean mountains. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy a new vehicle

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
This is Eden, 53, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, her business partner, and she is a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                     
        
Eden operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Eden hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Fátima está integrado por 12 mujeres muy activas y trabajadoras, que tienen un gran espíritu luchador y emprendedor. Ellas son jefas de familia, que desean poder ayudar a sus hijos y familiares a tener un mejor estilo de vida, y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Blanca, quien se dedica a la costura. Ella es una costurera muy buena, ya que tiene muchos clientes y siempre está llena de muchos pedidos que hacer. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y tener un gran taller de costura, para que de esa forma pueda tener mayores ingresos y ayudar a su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, y demás insumos para el taller de costura. Todas ellas agradecen a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “Virgen de Fátima” group is composed of 12 very active, hardworking women who have great enterprising and steadfast spirits.  They are heads of family who want to help their children and families to have better lifestyles so that they will not have to suffer any shortcomings.

One of the group members is Blanca who is a seamstress.  She is a very good seamstress since she has many customers and she’s always full of pending orders to fill.  Her goal is to continue working and to have a great workshop so that she can earn higher income and help her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy fabric, thread, glue and other sewing supplies.  All of them are grateful to Kiva and to the Fundación for the opportunity they are getting.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Lized

texts.es: La Sra. Lized  se dedica a la venta de verduras variadas los días de feria miércoles y sábados estos días son donde tiene bastante demanda de sus productos la señora sale muy temprano desde las 4 de la mañana donde adquiere los productos directamente de los productores   y posteriormente los comercializa en una calle muy populosa de la ciudad de Cochabamba de forma ambulante indica que tiene experiencia de 6 años en esta actividad; con el dinero del crédito comprar cemento para vaciar loza al piso de su vivienda y asi brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, vive en casa propia en la zona Sud una zona periurbana de la ciudad de Cochabamba, su familia esta conformada por su conyugue  que se encuentra trabajando en Argentina y sus 2 hijos los cuales aun son pequeños se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, la señora indica que esta actividad le permite mantener a su familia por lo que agradece la confianza en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Lized sells various vegetables on Wednesdays and Saturdays, which are the days of the fairs.  On these days there is considerable demand for her products.  She leaves very early in the morning, at 4:00 a.m., to acquire the products directly from the producers.  She then sells them in an itinerant manner on a very popular street in the city of Cochabamba. 

She has six years of experience in this line of work.  She will use the loan to buy cement to pour a concrete floor in her house.  This will make her family more comfortable.

She lives in her own home in the Sud region, a semi-urban part of the city of Cochabamba. Her family consists of her spouse, who works in Argentina, and her two young children, who go to school. 

Lized states that this business activity allows her to support her family, so she is grateful for the trust given to her by granting her the loan.

loans.use: to pour a concrete floor in her house.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren is a 41-year-old woman who lives with her husband and son in a 'ger' in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She has been running a meat and vegetable retail business at the trade center with her husband. It has been five years since she started the business. As she has made many regular customers, the business supplies the meat and vegetable needs of the local area. Dolgorsuren is a hardworking woman who says that, "I would like to expand the business activities by purchasing the meat from the herders in wholesale". The total amount she is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy fresh meat from the herders.

loans.use: To buy fresh meat from the herders

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en: Jovie is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 31 years old. Jovie is married and has four children. To make a living, Jovie is providing transportation services to local community members. Jovie has been in her business for six years and earns 2,300 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Jovie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovie is requesting a loan of 5,655 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Joakim

texts.en: Joakim is 27 years old and is a married man with 1 child. He is a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for 5 years. Joakim earns 6,000 PHP per month doing this farming. He is now preparing his land for planting and needs additional capital to fund his farm. He has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor and equipment rental. Joakim hopes that through his business, he will be able to elevate the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor and equipment rental

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Lilia is married and has eight children. To make a living, Lilia plants & harvests corn to sell. Lilia has been in her business for 23 years and earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lilia joined GDMPC. Lilia is requesting a loan of 5,244 PHP to purchase fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Tita has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home-use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, snacks, and beverages.

Tita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Tita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of shampoo, bath soap, beverages, snacks, and detergents

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Susana has a shop that sells a variety of fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy different kinds of fish, like milk fish, lion fish, tilapia, tam-ban, and dalagang bukid.

Susana has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Susana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fish to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 32 years old and married with two children who are 7 and 10 years old. Alicia grows rice to sell. She earns 4000 PHP per month doing this farming. Alicia is doing her best to support her family, especially her children's education. She has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. Alicia hopes to have a better yield and income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Serio is a widower with 3 children. Sergio is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Sergio is a farmer and grows vegetables, corn, and rice crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 40 years. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase farm supplies for his farm.

Sergio has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Sergio hopes to expand his farm for the future education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for his farm

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 51-year-old single mother of four children aged 21, 18, 13, and nine years, respectively. She sells potatoes in wholesale, a business she started four years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase 10 bags of potatoes, each at KES 3,000. The anticipated profit will aid her in repaying the loan as well as expanding her business. 

Jane hopes to make her business grow big, as well as educate her children. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase bags of potatoes

loans.name: Tolgonay

texts.ru:
Толгонай 45 лет, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве основного источника  дохода для своей семьи Толгонай занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес 15 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Толгонай ее хозяйство, начатое с покупки 2 коз на сегодня насчитывает 3 дойные коровы и 8 коз.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Толгонай обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Толгонай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Tolgonay is 45 years old and has 3 children. Tolgonay raises livestock, which provides her family's primary source of income. She began the business 15 years ago. Thanks to Tolgonay's tireless work she has gone from an initial purchase of 2 goats to today having 3 milk cows and 8 goats. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Tolgonay came to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan for purchase of additional livestock. She plans to invest profit earned from the loan into continued expansion of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Plaza Gabriel Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Plaza Gabriel” está conformado por  17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran artesanía en cerámica, lana, cuero y  preparación de comida rápida, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Coquimbo.
Jenny integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila, al medio ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha. Viste una chaqueta color gris, su cabello está tomado, el cual es de color negro y sus lentes de sol los tiene sobre su cabeza. 
Ella se dedica al rubro de la bisutería desde hace 7 años, (Trabajo que produce objetos o materiales de adorno que imitan a la joyería pero que están hechos de materiales no preciosos).
Realiza aros, collares y pulseras en piedra, para venderlos en un puesto que arrienda en una feria artesanal. Ahí trabaja de lunes a domingo de 11º de la mañana a 8ºº de la tarde. 
Los materiales que necesita para producir los compra al por mayor en locales comerciales, ubicados en algunos sectores de la ciudad de Santiago.
Su artesanía la promociona de boca en boca, de esta manera ha ido captando una mayor cantidad de clientes, quienes van rotando. 
Con el crédito comprará materiales para trabajar en sus productos de bisutería.
Una de las metas para su negocio es expandirlo a otras ciudades de Chile, ya que sus producciones son exclusivas y también de acuerdo a los pedidos que realicen sus clientes. Actualmente ya cuenta con clientes en la ciudad de Osorno y también a nivel internacional como Estados Unidos. Otro de sus sueños es instalarse con un local establecido.
Jenny vive junto a sus tres hijos de 17, 12 y 8 años de edad, ellos estudian y asisten a colegios tradicionales. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad económico que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta además que se siente muy cómoda al compartir las reuniones y capacitaciones con el grupo del cual forma parte, ya que son comprometidos y unidos. 
Coquimbo es una ciudad-puerto y por otro lado comuna-balneario, capital de la provincia de Elqui, IV Región de Coquimbo, Chile. La economía de la zona se basa principalmente en la minería ya que posee grandes yacimientos de magnesio, oro, plata, cobre, hierro y plomo. También hay agricultura que se desarrolla gracias al intensivo uso de los valles de Elqui, Limarí y Choapa con cultivos de hortalizas y frutas favorecidos por las condiciones del clima.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Plaza Gabriel” and it has 17 members who are in a variety of lines of work among which we have ceramic, wool and leather crafts, fast-food making, among others.  They are all from the city of Coquimbo.

Jenny is a member of the communal bank and in the photo is in the second row, second from left to right.  She’s wearing a gray jacket and her hair which is black is gathered and her sunglasses are on top of her head.

She has been working in costume jewelry for seven years (work that produces objects or decorative items that imitate jewelry but aren’t made with precious metals)

She makes hoops, necklaces and bracelets with stones to sell in a stand she rents in a crafts fair.  She works there Monday to Sunday from 11 in the morning until 8 at night.  The supplies she needs to produce she buys wholesale in commercial sites located in various parts of the city of Santiago.  She promotes her crafts by word of mouth and has acquired a larger clientele this way who rotate.

She will use the loan to buy supplies to work making costume jewelry.  One of her business goals is to expand it into other cities in Chile since her items are one-of-a-kind and made to order for customers.  She currently already has customers in the city of Osorno and also internationally like in the United States.  Another one of her dreams is to set up in a fixed locale.

She lives with her three children who are 17, 12 and 8 years old; they are students attending traditional schools.  She’s very happy and grateful for the economic opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her because it will allow her to invest in her business.

She also comments that she feels very comfortable sharing at the meetings and training sessions with the group she’s part of because they are committed and united.

Coquimbo is a port city and also a resort commune; it’s the capital of Elqui Province, Coquimbo Region IV, Chile.  The area’s economy is based mainly on mining since it has large deposits of magnesium, gold, silver, copper, iron and lead.  There is also agriculture that develops thanks to intensive use of the Elqui, Limarí and Choapa valleys to grow greens and fruit thanks to the favorable weather conditions.

loans.use: to buy jewelry making supplies.

loans.name: Samuel Wanyoike

texts.en:
Samuel used his previous loan amount to buy donkeys to support his water supply business in Naivasha town. It was very profitable and he was able to pay all of the loan well and in good time. Apart from the water selling business, he has had a motorcycle transport business now for the past two years.

This will be his third loan and he plans to use the loan amount to service his motorcycle, as well as to renew his driving license. This will enable him to keep his motorcycle in good condition and serve his customers well.

In the future, Samuel hopes to grow his business and own more motorcycles for the transport business.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru:
Венере 50 лет, воспитывает 4 детей. В качестве основного источника  дохода для своей семьи, Венера занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 2001 году. Благодаря упорному труду Венеры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодня имеется 1 дойная корова и теленок. Будучи активной и предприимчивой, Венера открыла ларек с продуктовыми товарами, что позволяет ей иметь  прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Венера обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Venera is 50 years old and has 4 children. Venera has raised livestock since 2001 as the sole source of income for her family.  Thanks to her tireless work she now owns a milk cow and calf. Being energetic and enterprising, Venera began operating a grocery stand which earns her a profit of 15,000 som (KGS) a month.  With the goal of further developing her business, Venera came to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 120,000 som (KGS) loan to buy additional livestock. She plans to invest the income earned from the loan into continued expansion of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Наргис имеет средне – специальное образование. По специальности она портниха. В этой области работает три года. Кредит берет для покупки тканей, чтобы сшить платья для продажи.
texts.en: Nargis lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children. Nargis has a specialized secondary education in dressmaking. She has worked in this profession for three years. She is requesting a loan for purchase of fabric, so that she can sew dresses to sell.

loans.use: buy fabric

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl es un hombre de 31 años de edad, vive con sus padres en casa propia, en el caserío Cruz Verde, a 10 minutos del distrito de La Matanza. Cuenta con buenas referencias laborales y personales. La gente de alrededores es amable y alegre.
Raúl se dedica a transportar a la población de un lugar a otro mediante un mototaxi (vehículo de 3 ruedas con carpa para albergar pasajeros) y adicionalmente vende plátanos de seda desde hace 3 años en su zona.
El crédito solicitado es de 1508 nuevos soles, los cuales se destinarán a específicamente, dar mantenimiento a su unidad y también para comprar urea para la parcela de plátano, teniendo así mejores posibilidades de ingresos para su familia y para que su condición de vida sea mucho mejor en la zona.
El mercado es bueno ya que es época escolar y sobre todo el cliente cuenta con alumnos ya fidelizados que los traslada de la matanza a cruz verde y es por eso que la inversión en el mantenimiento será beneficioso tanto para el así como para los pasajeros.
El objetico principal es dar un buen servicio  y sobre todo captar mas clientes y fidelizarlos, y para eso el cliente trabaja con respeto y responsabilidad, y sobre todo tiene una buena solvencia moral, y eso es la influencia para que nunca le falte el trabajo.
texts.en:
Raúl is a 31 year old man who lives with his parents in his house in the town of Cruz Verde, ten minutes outside of the township of La Matanza.  He has good work and personal references.  His neighbors are nice and happy.

Raúl's business is transporting people from one location to another by mototaxi (a vehicle on three wheels with a cabin to accommodate passengers), and he also has been selling bananas for the past three years in his region.

The asked for loan is 1508 Soles, which is specifically designated for maintenance on his unit and also to buy urea for his banana cultivating land.  This is how he will improve his chances for income for his family and so his life will be much better in his hometown.  The market is very good now that it's the school year, and most of his customers are students who are already regulars that he transports from La Matanza to Cruz Verde, and that's why the investment in maintenance will be a benefit as much for his customers as for himself.

His primary objective is to give good service and more than anything, to attract more customers and gain their loyalty, and for this reason he treats customers respectfully and responsibly and has an overall feeling of trustworthiness, and this is the reason that he will never want for work.

loans.use: to buy tools to maintain his farmland.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 40 years old and lives in Buenavista, Pagadian City. She is widowed with three children.

Merlita has a clothing business. She is engaged in selling different types of clothes and earns approximately PHP 28,000 (twenty eight thousand pesos) each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her clothing sales business.

Merlita has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Merlita hopes to expand her business and make her clothing business more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Micheki

texts.en:
Micheki is 52 years old. He is married to Felista and together they have four children. He is a farmer and has been in this business for the past 32 years.

This is his fifth term loan with KADET LTD. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

He hopes to buy another piece of land to expand his farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Нурали 7 лет как занимается торговлей. Ему 39 лет. На сегодняшний день у него имеется продуктовый магазин. Нурали женат. Он имеет троих детей. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Nurali has worked in sales for 7 years. He is 39 years old. He currently owns a grocery store. He is married and has three children. He is requesting a loan in order to increase sales.

loans.use: Buy inventory

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.ru: Шухратчон житель города Вахдат. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Шухратчон намерен купить автомобиль, чтобы дать в аренду. Он работает в одной компании директором. Сейчас у него одна автомашина марки STAREX, которую уже арендуют. Шухратчон берет кредит для приобретения еще одного автомобиля.
texts.en: Shuhratjon is a resident of the city of Vahdat. He is married and has two children. Shuhratjon is planning to buy a vehicle which can then be rented out. He works in a company where he is a manager. He currently has one STAREX brand vehicle which he already rents out. Shuhratjon is requesting a loan to buy another vehicle.

loans.use: To buy another vehicle

loans.name: Andelisia

texts.en:
Andelisia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Andelisia has a shop that sells a variety of vegetables. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy different kinds of fresh vegetables, like bitter melon, squash, okra, beans, and green leafy vegetables.

Andelisia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Andelisia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy balanced food for his animals and fertilizer to improve his cultivated land.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica es una mujer de 31 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos como carga familiar. Vive en casa propia, ubicada en el Caserío Los Almendros, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la zona rural del distrito, y sólo cuenta con el servicio de electricidad.
La actividad que desarrolla Mónica es la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora, la cual prepara en su propio domicilio y ya cuenta con clientela establecida, desde hace ya 4 años. Además, tiene aves de corral como gallinas y pavos. Su conviviente se dedica a la agricultura, teniendo una parcela heredada, la cual cosecha limón semanalmente.
El destino del crédito por 1500 nuevos soles es para la compra de insumos e implementos necesarios para la elaboración de la chicha, tales como maíz duro, azúcar, ollas, cucharones, y también para la compra de más aves.
texts.en:
Mónica is a 31 year old woman with a spouse and three children in her care.  She lives in her own house located in Los Almendros hamlet in Tambogrande District.  She lives in the rural part of the district and only has electricity.

Mónica’s activity is making and selling “chicha de jora” [drink based on fermented corn] that she makes at home; she has had an established clientele for four years already.  She also has barnyard fowl like chickens and turkeys.  Her spouse is a farmer; he has an inherited field that he harvests lemons from weekly.

The 1500 new sol loan will be used to buy ingredients and supplies needed to make the chicha like corn, sugar, pots, ladles and also to buy more fowl.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making 'chicha de jora' and to buy more barnyard fowl.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: La Sra. Roció tiene 27 años y es soltera con un hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la  atención de un café internet que se encuentra ubicado  en la zona de Tembladerani,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Roció utilizara este préstamo para la compra de  cabinas telefónicas para tener otro ingresos, las cabinas telefónicas funcionaran en su café internet, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere tener mas ingresos, la Sra. Roció  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en más activos para seguir creciendo, su deseo con el tiempo es poder tener su casita propia y que ahí funcione su café internet, la Sra. Roció es una persona joven emprendedora con ganas d superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Roció is 27 years old and single with a school-age child. She runs an internet cafe which is located in the area of Tembladerani. 

This loan is her first with the institution. Roció will use it to buy telephone booths in order to have another source of income. The phone booths will be installed in her internet cafe. The reason for requesting the loan is that she wants larger revenue. Roció faces challenges in her business, like increasing her income, and she will use the profit from investing in more assets to continue growing. 

Her wish is that with time she'll be able to have her own little home and from there run her internet cafe. Roció is a young, entrepreneurial person with the will to overcome. She is happy and appreciative to Emprender for the support given.

loans.use: to buy telephone booths.

loans.name: David Waithaka

texts.en:
David used his previous loan amount to buy a motorcycle for his transportation business. It has been very profitable and he was able to pay all of the loan amount well and in good time.

His water supply business has also been profitable and this being his third loan, he plans to use it to buy another donkey and boost the business by supplying water in good time and reach many customers.

In the future, David hopes to grow both of his businesses and start a taxi business in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy a donkey and boost his water supply business

loans.name: Bobojon

texts.ru: Бободжон проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 24 года. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Его мама работает продавщицей в продуктовом магазине. Сам Бободжон имеет высшее образование, он экономист по профессии. Сейчас он занимается торговлей компьютеров и запчастей компьютеров. Этим видом деятельности он занимается год. Кредит берет для приобретения нетбуков.
texts.en: Bobojon lives in Dushanbe. He is 24 years old and unmarried. He lives with his parents. His mother is a salesperson in a grocery store. Bobojon has a college education and is an economist by training. Now he sells computers and computer parts. He has been working in this business for a year. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase netbooks.

loans.use: purchase netbooks

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: A very hardworking and loving mother of three, Merlyn has been engaged in a transportation business for four years. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy spare parts, like tires, for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes that her children finish their studies so that they can achieve their dreams. Merlyn does anything just to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle business

loans.name: Vilma Soledad

texts.es:
Vilma es una mujer de 33 años de edad y es casada. Vive en casa propia en el caserío Granja Sasape en el distrito de Túcume. La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia la mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercialización de animales.

La actividad que realiza Vilma es la venta de animales menores, como aves de corral y otros. La realiza en su propio domicilio. Adicionalmente se dedica a labores relacionadas con la agricultura.

El monto del préstamo es de 4000 nuevos soles será destinado a la compra de más animales y de alimento balanceado para ellos y para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos propios. La venta de animales es un rubro con gran cantidad de competencia, pero bastante rentable.
texts.en:
Vilma is a 33 year old married woman.  She lives in her own house in Granja Sasape hamlet in Túcume District.  The community lives at the subsistence level.  Most are independent workers in businesses selling animals.

What Vilma does is sell small farm animals like barnyard fowl and others.  She carries this out at home.  She also does tasks related to agriculture.

The 4000 new soles will be used to buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them and for maintenance of her own crops.  Animal sales is a line of work with a great deal of competition but quite profitable.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 41-year-old Lebanese married man. He’s living with his wife and one school-aged child. He strives to work under pressure to offer a good future for his child. Joseph started to work in 2002, expecting to build a good career, and he succeeded. He’s now working as a plumber on a freelance basis, and has a fair number of clients asking for his services. Today, he’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his plumbing tools and equipment. He notes that he’s willing to take bigger projects and this Kiva loan will help him achieve his goal. In the future, he plans to open his own plumbing tools shop.

loans.use: to renew his plumbing tools and equipment

loans.name: Jayniel

texts.en:
Jayniel is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Jayniel is providing a multi-cab service by transporting passengers in the community. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan for 17,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Jayniel has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Jayniel hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and tools for the maintenance of the multi-cab

loans.name: Farukh

texts.ru: Фарух житель района Гиссар. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. У него имеется средне – специальное образование. Он пять лет проработал оператором. На сегодняшний день Фарух открыл дилерский центр, где занимается пополнением счетов мобильных телефонов и продает сим-карты. Кредит берет для приобретения сим-карт других мобильных линий.
texts.en: Farukh lives in the Gissar district. He is 26 years old and married. He has a technical secondary education. For five years he worked as an operator. Now he has opened a dealership where he replenishes mobile phone accounts and sells sim cards. He wants a loan to buy sim cards for other mobile phone lines.

loans.use: buy sim cards for other mobile phone lines.

loans.name: Eraj

texts.ru: Эрач житель Гиссарского района. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. Эрач занимается торговлей продуктов питания. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Eraj lives in Gissar. He is 25 years old and married. He sells groceries, a business he has been in for two years. He is taking out a loan in order to buy products with the aim of increasing sales.

loans.use: Buy grocery products to increase sales.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 29 years old and married with a five-year-old child. Her husband works as a farmer. Analyn is also a farmer and has been growing rice for five years. Analyn earns 2,000 PHP per month from farming. She works hard to improve her earnings and support her family. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor. She hopes to have more business capital in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Orestes

texts.es:
Orestes es un hombre de 44 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Vive en el caserío Fanupe, en el distrito de Mórrope. La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia la mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercio y crianza de animales adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura y a trabajar como dependientes.

La actividad a la que se dedica Orestes es el comercio de pescado y la crianza de animales pequeños en su propio domicilio. Su conviviente es la persona que se encarga de cuidar a sus animales. El comercio de animales y pescado lo realiza recorriendo las distintas zonas del distrito.

El monto del préstamo es de 3000 nuevos soles, los cuales tiene pensado ampliar corrales para la crianza y comprar alimento para engorde de animales menores y ganado vacuno. Además invertir en comercio de pescado, adquiriendo más kilaje de este producto.
texts.en:
Orestes is 44 years old, cohabits with a partner, and has 2 children in his care. He lives in the village of Fanupe, in the district of Mórrope. For their quality of life in the community and in order to survive the majority are self employed in businesses and breeding animals, and additionally working as hired labor in agriculture.

The activity that Orestes is dedicated to is the fish business and breeding small animals at his home. His partner is the person that is in charge of caring for the animals. The trade of animals and fish takes place in various areas of the district.

He is thinking of using the 3000 soles from the loan to expand the animal pens for breeding and to buy animal feed in order to fatten the little animals and livestock. Furthermore, he will invest in the fish trade, acquiring more poundage of this product.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for his animals and to expand their pens

loans.name: Validjon

texts.ru: Валиджон житель района Вахш. Ему 35 лет. Он занимается животноводством. В основном он откармливает и продает крупнорогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Validjon is a resident of the Vakhsh district.  He is 35 years old.  He is involved in animal husbandry.  Validjon primarily fattens up and sells cattle.  he has been in this business for 15 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy bulls.

loans.use: to buy bulls
